text: A dark, rumbling sky. Haze clings to the lake as we float across it, clearing to bring the opposite shoreline into  view. A few scattered streetlights. Dilapidated cabins.  An abandoned campsite. CAMP CRYSTAL LAKE.  We continue to drift towards it, hearing the faint sound  of seductive music and an occasional giggle. A small  HOUSEBOAT floats into our foreground, its interior light  flickering as TWO BODIES move around inside.
A teenage boy and girl, JIM and SUZY, are slow-dancing.  Jim's lips softly touch her lissome shoulders.
Well...how do you feel?
Ask me in about five minutes. She bites his ear, giggles, then kisses him fully..
I'm talking about graduation. Being  totally free to do whatever we want  now. Her hands slip inside his Pendleton shirt. He sighs.
It feels excellent. Her mouth finds his again. After a long kiss, he gently  pulls away from her with a teasing smile.
Gotta throw the anchor over. He leaves the cabin. She slips under the bed sheets.
as Jim tosses a small anchor overboard.
as the weighty object splashes, sinking into black  oblivion, pulling its cable down with it.
glances at the lake, at their eerie surroundings. He  feels a chill, heading back inside.
as the anchor drifts to the lake bottom, dropping a few  feet from a THICK POWER CABLE which rests in the lake  silt.
as Jim returns with an uneasy expression. He crawls on  top of the bed, kissing her again, but not with the same  enthusiasm as before.
What's wrong?
Nothing. He starts to pull off his shirt and join her. She senses  his anxiety.
C'mon, Jimmy. Something's bothering  you. Jim pauses, turning off the mood music.
It's just that we're right around that  old summer camp where all those  murders took place. The boat creaks. She's instantly nervous.
What murders?
Never mind, you don't want to know  about it.
Tell me.
There's nothing to worry about, Suzy.  The guy's dead now, somewhere at the  bottom of this lake...if you believe  the stories. (beat)
Let's drop it, okay? He starts to kiss her again. She stops him.
What stories? He doesn't want to go into it but Suzy's face insists.
There was this boy named Jason  Voorhees who drowned in Crystal  Lake...
Eight year old JASON is desperately trying to tread  water, flailing his arms like a marionette to get  attention as he gulps down gallons of mossy lake water.
Hhhhelp....me....I'm drowning...
None of the counselors heard him.
Mmmmmmommy.... ...And Jason finally slips under the surface for good.
A bunch of years went by and everybody  forgot about it. (beat)
That's when the murders started.

as our senses are bombarded with QUICK CUTS of assorted teenagers just about to die, their screams echoing over  each other. We do not see the attacker. As the  cacophony reaches a screeching crescendo, CUT BACK TO:
as the silence hits us hard again.
Jason did it...?
That's what some people thought. But  they were wrong.
as MRS. VOORHEES comes directly at camera wielding a huge knife and a primal scream.
His mother blamed the counselors for  his death and tried to kill them all. (dramatic pause)
She got her head chopped off by one of  them. We don't need to see this clip...Suzy's reaction is quite sufficient.
So the murders stopped? He gives her a long, penetrating look.
No.

We're bombarded with QUICK FLASHES of a hockey masked  JASON wreaking havoc on assorted teenagers...brandishing  everything from hatchets to knives to chainsaws. Just as  Jason is about to stab us, CUT BACK TO:
Suzy flinches as if she were getting the knife.
Legend has it that Jason came back to  avenge his mother's death, vowing to  kill every teenager from the area.  (beat)
And every now and then, the murders  start up again.  The boat lurches slightly, tugging at the anchor cable.  She's scared: he's frightened himself a little, too.

Forget about it, Suzy. They're just  stories. He brushes her hair back, kissing her cheek gently,  finding the nape of her neck again. She closes her eyes,  trying to dismiss what he's dredged up. But she can't.  Suzy begins to rationalize.
We're the last graduating class,  right?  Jim's kissing her body, putting Jason behind him.
Right.
I mean, Lakeview High just closed its  doors for good, right?
Right.
So there's no reason for him to come  back because there won't be any of us  around...right? Jim stops, looking her squarely in the eyes.
Right. Except that Jason isn't real  so none of it matters anyway. She starts to relax, returning his kisses.
as the anchor drifts along the lake floor, tugging hard  on the power cable. Camera TRACKS along the cable,  coming to a RUSTY SET OF CHAINS TANGLED AROUND IT.
as Jim slides on top of Suzy. Thoughts of Jason are  starting to slip away along with their clothes.

as the chains emit a dull tinkle due to movement from the tugging anchor. Camera continues to TRACK again...and we  find to our horror that the waterlogged, fish-eaten body  of JASON IS SECURED BY THESE SAME CHAINS. (NOTE: Jason's  face is obscured.)
Teenagers in love, lost in not-so-innocent passion. At  the same moment:
The anchor tugs one last time and RIPS THROUGH THE CABLE. SPARKS INSTANTLY FLY, chasing along the cable, finding  the chain which secures Jason and ENGULFING HIM IN  ELECTRICITY.
as BRIGHT FLASHES OF BLUE LIGHT strobe-under the surface. ARCING CURRENT chases up the anchor cable, sparking  across the hoist.
as the electricity feeding the streetlights is abruptly  extinguished, plunging the campsite into darkness.
as Suzy's eyes flash open.
Did you hear that?
Hear what? He pulls her back down.
C'mon, I'm serious. He knows the mood is broken.
All right, I'll check it out. He slips on his jeans, exiting the cabin. She pulls the  sheet up around her fearfully.
as the cable smolders, void of electricity now. TRACK to  find the chains again...but they're dangling loosely.  JASON IS GONE.
Suzy is tensely kneeling on the bed now. The black void  of night is all she sees out the cabin door, which Jim  has left open. An uncomfortable amount of time passes.
Jimmy...? No answer. Her heart starts to pound.
Jim...? Again, nothing. She wraps herself in the sheet, moving  towards the open door. The ship creaks again.
as she grows closer to the doorway, nothing but pitch- black beyond it.
Stop screwing around, Jim. I mean  it... ...And just as she reaches the door:
leaps out, clutching a HUGE KNIFE. Suzy barely has time  to scream before JASON PLUNGES THE KNIFE INTO HER CHEST.
stands there in speechless shock, looking down at her  mortal wound. But there's no blood.
pulls the knife back out, pushing the blade in and out  with his hand. It's a retractable rubber knife. JIM  pulls off the hockey mask with a huge grin, tossing it  aside.
Gotcha good, baby cakes. She doesn't know whether to hug him with relief or kick  him in the balls. He pulls her back onto the bed,  laughing.
sitting dormant on the deck, where Jim tossed it. A  SHADOW FALLS ACROSS IT...followed by a SLIMY, DECOMPOSING HAND. The hand grabs it like it's an old friend, pulling  it away.
as Jim holds his angry girlfriend down on the bed, trying unsuccessfully to kiss her.
All right, all right -- I'm a major  ass.
And you'll never do it again.
And I'll never do it again. Forgive  me?
No. She's resisting only for effect. Her legs curl around  him, finally giving in.
A deadly-sharp SPEAR GUN rests in its rack outside the  cabin. JASON'S HAND REMOVES IT.
The sheets begin to roll like waves as they work each  other. Thoughts of Jason are nonexistent now.
Nothing there for a moment...then a pair of moss-covered  BARE FEET SLOSH INTO FRAME.
closes her eyes with pleasure...
...and camera RISES from the mossy feet, up the bloodless legs and torso to ultimately reveal the hockey-masked  face of our anti-hero: JASON VOORHEES.
lets out a broad smile, her eyelids fluttering. They stay open long enough to regard the visitor in the doorway.  She tries to choke out a warning to Jim, who's just  collapsed himself.
JJJJJJJJason... He doesn't follow her glance, smiling instead.
Uh-huh. You must really think I'm an  ass. But she continues to stare in horror as:
raises the spear, taking aim.

Hs starts to kiss her but she bolts up with a blood- curdling SCREAM. A second later, JASON FIRES THE SPEAR,  PIERCING HER NECK, PINNING HER TO THE HEAD BOARD. Jim stares point-blank at his dead girlfriend, not able  to assimilate it quickly enough. He spins around to see  the monster himself.

Ohmygod... Jim springs off the bed, looking around for anything to  defend himself with, grabbing the bedside lamp. He  SMASHES IT OVER JASON'S HEAD which has little effect. Jim scrambles to get past him, but Jason LIFTS JIM IN THE  AIR, SLAMMING HIM DOWN ON ONE OF THE SPIKED BEDPOSTS.
as the HOUSEBOAT silently drifts onward. The lone  silhouette of Jason emerges from within, taking the helm. He's back.
Only the faintest sign of daylight can be seen through a  thick blanket of gray fog. In the distance, speckled  lights outlining a smaller LUXURY CRUISE SHIP  intermittently appear.

Standing at the boarding ramp is CHARLES MCCULLOCH,  clipboard in hand. He's just finished checking off a pair of new-agey SENIOR GIRLS. McCulloch is approaching fifty, wearing a tie and unwrinkled clothes, as well as the  disposition of a stern puritan.

Remember girls, the shuffleboard  tournament will start at six p.m.  sharp. A non-attendance will restrict  your time in port, understood? They nod for his benefit, exchanging derogatory whispers  as they head up the ramp. Camera ADJUSTS to find a small  parking lot adjacent to the docks, where several cars are just now arriving -- parents dropping off their high  school seniors, hugging them bon voyage.
as SEAN ROBERTSON walks toward the ship with pal MILES  WOLFE. Sean's a tall, nice looking, somewhat serious guy; Miles is shorter, athletic and more extroverted.
You're telling me this boat has a pool  with a three meter board?
It's a ship and that's right. Plus a  disco, gym, game room and a lot more.
I think I'm gonna blow off New York  and just stay on this thing.
You'll do no such thing, Mr. Wolfe...  Camera ADJUSTS to reveal McCulloch, holding his list,  checking off their names.
Your itinerary has been carefully  planned and make no mistake, it will  be executed accordingly.
(under his breath)
Of course...wouldn't want to risk  enjoying this trip. McCulloch gives him a frown. Sean steps up to him  tentatively.
Which cabin is Rennie in, Mr.  McCulloch?
Rennie's not coming. He's devastated.
But I thought...
She changed her mind. (eyeing list)
Let's see...Mr. Wolfe is in stateroom  one-eleven and you, Mr. Robertson, are  in two-twenty-five. A booming VOICE from above interrupts them:
Sean -- where the hell have you been?  We're already into early departure  protocol...

Standing on the upper deck is a no-nonsense, uniformed  Navy man, ADMIRAL ROBERTSON. The captain of the ship. And Sean's father. Sean's sadness about Rennie's absence is  immediately replaced with anxiety.
Be right up, Dad. He and Miles head up the gangway, both boys giving  McCulloch one last glare.

Behind the wheel is MISS COLLEEN VAN DEUSEN, thirties,  attractive, a progressive attitude. RENNIE WICKHAM sits  next to her -- she's seventeen, pretty, slightly  withdrawn. Rennie's dog TOBY, a border collie, rides in  the back seat.
I'm glad you decided to come after  all.
Me too. But I'm not sure Uncle Charles  will be.
You let me worry about him, okay? (pause)
Personal experiences are what fuel the  minds of great writers, Rennie. You  made the right decision.
What about not-so-great writers? Rennie smiles self-deprecatingly, Miss Van Deusen  grinning back. But Rennie's smiles are few and far  between, this one disappearing as she glances out the  window.
as the countless gallons of harbor and lake water spread  out before her, eery in the bog. A small ROWBOAT grazes  across it occupied by two indistinguishable people.
Rennie's eyes show a hidden terror. She quickly turns  away, shivering briefly. Miss Van Deusen notices. She  turns a corner, heading into the parking lot.
Everything okay?
Just felt a little chill. Rennie rubs her arms, faking coldness.
Did you know that I'm giving up  teaching?
Really?
Since the school is closing anyway,  I'm going to write that novel I've  been threatening on everybody.
That's wonderful, Miss Van  Deusen...what's it about? She parks the car, turning off the ignition.
A senior class cruise to Manhattan,  laced with romance, adventure and  murder. (beat)

Or a Gothic cook book. I haven't  decided which. She's coaxed the smile out of Rennie again. Miss Van  Deusen pulls a small wrapped box from her glove  compartment, handing it to Rennie, who seems utterly  surprised.
Go on, open it. Rennie pops off the lid, revealing an antique ink-dip  pen.
Stephen King supposedly used it when  he was in high school.
I don't know what to say...

Rennie, you're the best student I ever  had...you have a real gift. If anybody  can make use of that pen, it's you. Rennie hugs her teacher. Camera RISES above the car's  window, finding a Mercedes 560 SL pulling in a short  distance away.

A sexy, money-dressed blonde is behind the wheel. TAMARA  MASON. She climbs from her leather seats as a trio of  SENIOR GIRLS walk by, offering enthusiastic hi's and  hellos. She's obviously Miss Popular. Tamara crosses to a cute Japanese girl unloading luggage from a beige Honda,  EVA WATANABE.
Are you ready for drugs, sex and rock  'n roll or what, girl? Eva gives her a warning glance, nodding to her left.  Eva's MOTHER appears by the passenger door, forcing a  smile at Tamara.
Hello, Tamara.
Hi, Mrs. Watanabe. Just kidding.
Yes, I'm sure. Embarrassed, Eva hurries to her Mom, rushing a kiss  goodbye.

Don't worry about a thing, Mom. I'll  have a terrific time and I won't do  anything stupid, okay? Before Mrs. Watanabe can squeeze a word in, her daughter  is gone. She waves a bittersweet goodbye to her graduate.
I love you...
Once they're out of Mrs. Watanabe's earshot --
I hear the crew members are cute guys  in their twenties.
Really?
I'm sure we'll have no problem getting  them to party with us...especially  with this. Tamara unzips her purse, revealing a baggie filled with  fine white powder. Eva looks very nervous.
It's my graduation gift from Daddy. It  cost over a thousand bucks but it's  the best.
He bought you that?
More or less. It's part of my college  fund. She grins coquettishly, walking on. Camera HOLDS on the  calm, foggy harbor...where the faint image of a HOUSEBOAT is aimlessly drifting into port.
Sure enough, it's the same one we saw JASON on last  night...but no one is behind the helm. It seems to be a  ghost ship.
as Tamara tries to slip past McCulloch, busy with another pair of seniors.
You can stop right there, Miss Mason. He motions the others onward. Busted. Tamara instantly  hands Eva her drug-filled purse, paralyzing Eva.
Only graduating seniors are allowed on  this cruise.
What are you talking about?
You never turned in your final biology  project, so I've had your diploma  rescinded.
You can't do that...
It's already been done. (turning to Eva)
Congratulations on the 3.9 average,  Miss Watanabe. You're in stateroom two- fifty-five. Eva smiles awkwardly, reaching for her luggage, stalling  to see what happens with Tamara.
Look, Mr. McCulloch, I got in a car  accident yesterday and missed our  appointment. It's okay, no big deal,  just a bruised arm... (squeezes her arm)
...so I brought my project along  today. It's in my suitcase. Really. He looks at her suitcase, not buying a word of this.
She's telling the truth, Mr.  McCulloch. I saw her pack it. He's surprised to hear this...and so is Tamara.
All right. But if it mysteriously  disappears en route, I'll have you  sent back home the minute we dock.  Understood?
Perfectly. She grabs her purse back from Eva, quickly moving on  before he changes his mind. Their voices become whispers.
A major prick.
What are you going to do?
Improvise, of course.
as the HOUSEBOAT haphazardly bumps into barnacle-covered  dock pilings, still around fifty yards from the cruise  ship.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW OUT HOUSEBOAT WINDOW

text: The window is splattered with blood, but still clear  enough to make out Tamara and Eva walking up the gangway, along with a half dozen other teenagers mingling on  board.

--or rather the remnants of it. It's a piece of frayed  woven metal charred by extreme electricity, severed just  above water level. Suddenly there's blurry movement  behind it; camera RACK FOCUSES just in time to catch a  glimpse of JASON SLIPPING OFF THE SIDE, FLOATING TOWARDS  THE PILINGS.
as McCulloch impatiently checks his watch and list again. Miss Van Deusen walks up to him.
Hello, Charles. Has everyone checked  in?
Jim Miller and Suzy Donaldson never  showed up. I'm a little concerned.
Don't be. They probably decided to  explore each other rather than New  York. He gives her a disdainful look, starting up the ramp.
Let's go -- we're running two minutes  late.
Charles, there's someone else coming  along too. He stops, following her glance. His face tightens.

Rennie is walking toward them with a small suitcase, her  dog Toby striding next to her. She walks up to him,  starts to say something, then decides against it. Rennie  heads up the gangway. HOLD on McCulloch and Miss Van  Deusen. He's livid.
You have no right...
And neither do you. It's up to Rennie to decide what she wants to do.
She doesn't know what she wants. She's  never had a stable life.
And she sure doesn't have one now,  either. She needs to live.
I'm her legal guardian, not you or  anybody else, and I alone know what's  best for her. End of discussion.
No, I think it's just the beginning. She walks past him.
as she reaches the top of the gangway, her heart  pounding. Rennie pauses, working up the courage to look  out at the lake again.
The ROWBOAT she saw earlier is still there, even closer  now.
contract, her blood pumping faster. Then she hears a  FAINT VOICE BELOW HER...
Hhhhelp me... Rennie looks straight down at the water beneath her and  sees:
floundering in the water. It takes us only a moment to  recognize him -- IT'S YOUNG JASON. He's gasping, sucking  in huge amounts of liquid, exactly like he did in the  prologue.
Hhhhelp me....I'm drowning...
leans back in terror, falling into Miss Van Deusen.
What's wrong, Rennie?? Rennie frantically points over the ramp edge, unable to  speak. Miss Van Deusen quickly looks and sees:

head_text.subj: MISS VAN DEUSEN'S POINT OF VIEW

text: The water is calm. No Young Jason.
as Rennie gets a hold of herself.
I just got a little dizzy. I'm fine. She continues up the ramp. HOLD on Miss Van Deusen,  watching her go, somewhat troubled by it. RACK to  McCulloch below her, also watching. Extremely concerned.

continues along the starboard side, not risking another  glance overboard. She passes an older, very deranged DECK HAND, mopping the deck. HOLD on him, his bloodshot eyes  following her like a crazed raven.

Sharp and rusty, mounted on the wall amidst jagged  scaling knives, shark jaws and other artifacts. WIDEN to  reveal they are surrounding a navigational chart on the  cruise ship's bridge. Admiral Robertson and his CHIEF  ENGINEER are preparing for departure, checking the OMEGA  satellite computer as well as the LORAN.
(checking watch)
Let's take in the brow.
Yes Sir. (into intercom phone.)
Take in the gangway and single up all  lines. SEAN and MILES enter the room; Sean gets a glance from  his Dad. Miles is very impressed with the bridge.
Hello, Dad.
Hey, Admiral Robertson. Love your  ship.
She's a beauty, isn't she? I should've  retired from the Navy ten years ago.
You've really been generous to give us  this cruise. I know I speak for  everybody on board. Everybody...with the possible exception of Sean. He  avoids eye contact with his father.
Hell, there's just twenty or so of you  -- we only need a skeleton crew and  it's a pleasure to sail her anyway. (beat)

By the way, congratulations on winning  the intramural diving championships,  Miles. I'm sure you made your old man  proud. Admiral Robertson gives his own son a glance; maybe Sean  should think about doing the same.
Have you decided on your departure  protocol, Admiral?
Actually, I thought I'd leave the  honors to my son.
Dad, I don't think...
(to Chief Engineer, ignoring  Sean)
Relinquishing command of the Princess  Ruby to Captain Sean Robertson. Sean has no say in the matter. Miles can feel his  friend's nervousness as well.
But before you take the helm, take  this. He tosses Sean a wrapped box. Sean opens it. Inside is a  navigational computer the size of a calculator, sitting  next to a rusty old sextant.
Something old and something new. I  used the sextant when I was your age,  but now they have these goddamn  computers to do all the work for you.
(to Sean)
Have you decided on a plan of  departure, Captain? Sean's nervous. He eyes the Omega, quickly glancing at  the LORAN, briefly referring to the navigational chart.
How about if we start up the forward  engines and come around. 180  degrees...

Aren't you forgetting something? Sean looks flustered. Admiral Robertson storms to a  large button, pressing it three times, piercing the air  with three long blasts of the ship's horn. It  underscores his frustration.

We're in foggy weather! Send out the  international maritime signal that a  vessel is backing down, followed by a  security broadcast warning other  ships! He shoves the mike out at Sean, but he doesn't grab it,  leaving the bridge, humiliated. There's an awkward moment for Miles, unable to find any appropriate words. He exits as well. Admiral Robertson stares out the bridge window,  saddened and frustrated. It wasn't supposed to go this  way.
as he continues away, his retreat blocked by the DECK  HAND. The crazy old man pierces a dead serious stare at  Sean.
This voyage is doomed.
Yeah, tell me about it. Sean sidesteps him, moving on.

Parents and relatives wave gleefully from the docks as  CAMERA RISES AND ROTATES to find eighteen or so teenagers 1ining the upper deck, happily waving back. The ship  begins to slice through serene water. The voyage has  begun.

The water begins to ripple as the ship's speed increases. All seems normal...until JASON'S HANDS APPEAR, CLINGING  TO A LOOSE MOORING LINE DRAGGING IN THE WATER. He  slithers up the side towards the deck as dense fog  breezes past him.
as Sean continues along, hands in pockets. He turns a  corner and collides with RENNIE, walking her dog. His  eyes instantly brighten, as do hers.
Rennie...
Hi, Sean.
I heard you weren't coming.
(glances at Toby)

We changed our minds. Sean pats her dog. There's an awkward pause...they are  obviously in the early stages-of a relationship.  Sean reaches into his coat pocket, bringing back a small  necklace-sized box.
I got you a present.
But I didn't get you one...
Forget it. It's a dumb little thing  anyway. Rennie opens it up, exposing a petite silver necklace  with a Statue of Liberty pendant on it. She's touched.
Sean...it's beautiful. Sean takes it from her, snapping it around her neck.
I thought maybe we could hike to the  top of the Statue when we got there,  if you felt like it. It's supposed to  be 22 stories tall.
I'd love to.
Your father was looking for you, Mr.  Robertson. McCulloch appears behind them. The mood has been broken.
I guess I'll see you later. Sean leaves. McCulloch steps up to Rennie, pointing out  to the foggy sea. Her respiration increases as she  psyches herself up to look.
There's a storm predicted tonight.  Rennie looks at the ocean, forcing herself not to turn  away.
You're making a big mistake, Rennie.  It's not too late to put you back on  land.
I'm staying.
If Miss Van Deusen knew how afraid you  were of...
She didn't push me into coming.
Why are you doing this to yourself?
I don't even know why I'm afraid,  Uncle Charles. I can't even remember  when it started. Don't you think it's  time I found out and got over it? He takes a measured pause.
Facing your fear doesn't always  conquer it.
I'm staying. He's not going to change her mind.

through a porthole window...and through the viewfinder  of a video camcorder. McCulloch shakes his head, turning  away from Rennie and walking away. A sinister electric  guitar solo screeches out. PAN with McCulloch as he  passes the window, coming around 180 degrees into a CLOSE UP of J.J. JARRETT, fingering a sleek Gibson "Flying V."
(into camera)
Is this axe awesome or what?

as J.J., a female rocker in the vein of band "Vixen,"  continues to wail on her guitar. She's wearing a black  leather corset, with wildly teased deep red hair. Holding the camcorder is WAYNE WEBBER, MTV-acclimated, wearing  the latest hip prescription glasses.
Too cool, J.J. Your parents came  through. She pops out the guitar cable from her practice amp.
No lie. I hear there's a big power  room down below where I can get  supreme concert hall echo. Come down  and shoot a basement tape on me, okay?
Sure...but I gotta shoot some  shockumentary footage first. He avoids eye contact when he says it. She gives him a  look.
Man, don't tell me you're still trying  to scam on Tamara... His non-answer means yes. J.J. walks over to him,  grabbing his cheeks, shaking them like jello.
How long have we known each other?  Don't be a dweeb, Wayne. She's not  interested in you, only what you can  do for her. She's a user.
She's sexy.
So's this guitar. So what?
I'll catch you later. He exits. She mumbles something under her breath, coiling up her amp cord.

as he walks onward. DROP DOWN to find his FEET as he  passes a DARK ALCOVE...which happens to have SLIMY  FOOTPRINTS AND SEAWEED leading into it. Camera FOLLOWS  the footprints, RISING again and with dim recognition,  our eyes fall on JASON. Lurking in the shadows. But not  for long.

Massive, very dark, backlit steam seeping from a maze of  pipes overhead. No windows. A wall of circuit breakers  and voltage meters decorate one wall, quietly humming  generators on the opposite side. J.J. appears with her  guitar, amp and ghetto blaster, appreciative of the  surroundings.
This place is aching for a video.  Wayne, you're an asshole. She finds an outlet and plugs in her equipment.

We're peering at J.J. predatorially through the steam,  moving through it, behind the generators. J.J. pops a cassette into her blaster, jamming the "play"  button. A loud rock 'n roll rhythm track blasts out.
moving around the generators, eyeing her sleek leather  pants as she bends over to plug in her axe.
as J.J. snaps the male end of the plug into the female.  receptacle.

appears for an instant through the vapor, then vanishes. J.J. screams out the opening licks of her solo in sync with  her playback. The generators are causing a breeze which  makes her hair dance, steam flowing between her legs.  She's lost in her music, building to a crescendo, bending the high "E" string above the upper octave fret. She  opens her eyes with the pleasure of it and sees:
emerging from a cloud of vapor like her worst nightmare.
as J.J.'s SCREAM echoes from an exhaust duct. WHIP PAN to find the crazed DECK HAND standing just below it,  reacting with dread. He's the only one who has heard it.

as Jason tears the guitar off her body, raising it in the air like a hatchet. The horrified girl flees down a  narrow maze of steel steps, forced back against a  generator with nowhere to go. PUSH IN on her face for one last look at her before:
swings the guitar downward and buries it in J.J.'s skull.

as the Deck Hand flinches upon the thick, dull sound of  her demise, followed by discordant feedback from her  guitar...and eventual silence. He reaches into his breast pocket, his hand shaking badly as he sips from a flask of Early Times.
as LIGHTNING FLASHES over a gray, choppy sea. A storm is  imminent. The Princess Ruby finally appears, cutting  through whitecaps, no land in sight.
as Rennie's hand carefully dips it in India ink, moving  to a blank page in her journal. She hesitates for several beats.
No inspiration. She puts down the pen, looking at her  dog, who's curled up on the bed.
What do you think...time for some  personal experiences to fuel our  minds? The dog's eyes blink, but no more than that.
I agree. Rennie moves to her closet, finding a silk blouse and  some black satin pants.
Wind is picking up, sweeping thick mist past a row of  decorative flags. One of them flaps back...AND EXPOSES  JASON.

as the flag whips our faces. We MOVE through it, down the empty passageway, coming to a porthole window. Rennie's  window. We peer through it with unnerving intensity at  the backside of Rennie as she pulls off her T-shirt,  slipping on the blouse. Camera continues through the  tiny round window, floating across the room, over Toby  and the bed...until we're INCHES FROM THE BACK OF  RENNIE'S HEAD. She suddenly spins around in fright,  facing us point-blank, and:
Nobody is there, her porthole window empty. But there's  something surreal about the window...
Empty grayness...then EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON FLOATS UP FROM BELOW, BUBBLES ESCAPING FROM HIS LIPS. The porthole has  become a window into the depths of Crystal Lake.
feels her throat catch with terror and an instant later:
begins to bark vociferously, rushing to her cabin door,  scratching to get out.
are distracted to Toby for a second; when she looks back  at the porthole, she sees:
No water, no drowning boy.
snaps out of it, moving to the door, where her dog is  frantically clawing with his fur up.

Okay Toby, calm down... She's talking to herself as much as the dog. Rennie  closes the curtains on her window, then steps to her  door. She swings the door open for Toby...and exposes  an empty hall. Toby scrapes his way out of the room,  dashing off down the hall, snarling.
as Toby runs straight toward us. PAN with him as he  rushes around a corner, leading us into a view of TAMARA  and EVA, disappearing down a staircase.

A strong seventeen year-old black kid, JULIUS GAW, is  going a few rounds with another senior boy who's clearly  losing the boxing match. Julius dances around him on the  mat like he's Mike Tyson, several other boys cheering  them on.
as Tamara and Eva step into view. Eva glances around,  feeling out of place in the men's locker room.
I'm not sure we're supposed to be  here, Tamara. A couple of skinny boys wearing only towels walk by. But  Tamara doesn't notice them, her face pressed up against  the glass, watching Julius.

Is that a muscular bod or what? Tamara puts on a sexy smile. The other boxer sees her  instead, instantly distracted. Julius lays him out with a left-right-left combination. The onlookers applaud.  Julius pulls out his mouthpiece, giving Tamara a wicked  smile.
He's undefeated, you know that? (beat)
Julius is the only senior I'd even  consider doing it with. If he wasn't  black, that is.
(awkward)
My parents are open minded about that  sort of thing.
My stepmom couldn't care less, but  Daddy would have a shit fit. (lets it slip out)
He might even pay some attention to  me. Tamara quickly puts up her veneer again, spotting  something.

Gorgeous guy at ten o'clock. Look  sensual. Both girls slip into instant sultry as a CREW MEMBER in  his mid-twenties passes them, wearing a tool belt. Very  masculine. He gives the girls a pleasant smile. Tamara  turns around to check out his back side.
I think it's time for some  recreational activity, girl.
Sounds good. I hear there's a  shuffleboard court on deck -- it might  be kinds cool...
You're joking, right? She wasn't, but Eva tries to act like she was. Tamara  walks on, Eva following.
as McCulloch steps from Rennie's room, looking very  worried. Wayne Webber passes by, his eye stuck in his  viewfinder. McCulloch yanks the camcorder away from his  face.
Have you seen my niece anywhere?
Yeah, motivating downstairs, I think.  What's the problem, Mr. McCulloch?
Senior predictions started five  minutes ago and she hasn't shown up.
Some of us don't want our futures  predicted.
In your case I'm sure that's true. He brushes past Wayne angrily.
as Tamara drags Eva into a secluded service area, pulling out her mirror, straw and baggie.
The night time is the right time.  Tamara hands the straw to Eva.
(nervous)
No thanks.
What? Don't be a lightweight...this is  top dollar toot.
It's not that, it's just that... (beat)
It I get caught, I'll lose my science  scholarship and everything.
You're talking to the prom queen,  Eva. Do you really think I'm going to  risk getting caught?
(a pause)
I guess not.
Do you realize how many people would  kill to be sitting here right now?  Come on, it's grad night. You've got  your whole life to be uptight. Eva takes the straw.
as we move down the corridor, in and out of shadows,  hearing giggles from Tamara and Eva up ahead. Jason's  coming...
as Eva takes a nosefull, sneezing badly.

Is that unbelievable or what? Tamara giggles, getting ready to tap out another line.  But the snickering stops upon the sound of APPROACHING  FOOTSTEPS. They both look up, every muscle tensing with  fear as:
appears from the shadows, just as startled to see them.  It's not Jason at all. Rennie can't help noticing the  cocaine, trying hard to ignore it.
Jesus, you scared the hell out of us.
Have you seen my dog? I think he came  this way.
No, we haven't. (awkwardly)
Care for a hit?
No thanks. Rennie continues on. After she's gone...
A real space cadet. I wonder if she'll  narc on us...
I have her in Creative Writing and  she's fairly nice.
Nobody related to McCulloch can be  nice. Tamara puts the straw to her nose.
as she presses on, the corridor getting darker.

Toby? No reply. She walks on, turning down the left hallway...  but camera turns down the right hallway. Suddenly JASON  REVEALS HIMSELF, quietly stepping from the GAME ROOM.  He's holding a pool cue, which he proceeds to snap in  half, providing a splintery sharp shaft.
as Tamara finishes off her line, wiping her nose with a  sniffle.
Oh yeah. Ready to party and then some. She rolls up her baggie, stuffing it into her purse.
as we come down a corridor, turning into the Service  Area, stomping right up to Tamara and Eva. They both  GASP; Tamara drops her mirror, which SHATTERS on the  ground.
They are facing McCulloch.
What are you doing in here?
Nothing. He eyes the broken mirror. He wasn't born yesterday.
Are you girls using drugs?
Do you think I would use drugs, Mr.  McCulloch? We were just exploring the  ship. He doesn't want to believe Eva is a druggie. But Tamara  is a different matter. He levels his eyes on her.
I'11 be coming around your stateroom  in exactly fifteen minutes, Miss  Mason. You'd better have your biology  project ready or I'm phoning your  parents.
They're out of town.
Then I'll make sure you remain on  board while your classmates see the  sights. He's gotten to her with that one. McCulloch storms away.
What are you going to do?
Relax, I've got McCulloch covered...  but that little narcing bitch niece of  his is a different matter. (calculating)
Rumor has it she's a teensy bit afraid  of the water...

as a body pierces the surface of the deck swimming pool.  It's MILES, having just completed a dive from the high  board. Miss Van Deusen and several others stand at  poolside, giving him some applause.
Poetry in motion, Miles.
A half-twist short. I'll hone that  dive yet. He swims to the side, leading us to a view of Rennie.  She's very cautious about getting too close to the pool  edge as she approaches Miss Van Deusen.
Rennie -- I was just on my way over to  your room
Have you seen my dog anywhere?
No, but I'm sure Toby's fine. The  ship's only so big and there's  certainly no way off it, is there? She smiles reassuringly, but her words are less than  comforting.
as the canine continues to sniff out Jason through the  maze of corridors. TRACK with the dog as he slows his  pace, knowing he's getting close to something.

Low to the ground, creeping past a steam vent which  obscures his vision, then turning down a metal staircase, weaving into another passageway. Then with absolutely no  warning, A BODY FALLS FROM ABOVE, THUDDING DIRECTLY IN  FRONT OF US.
rears back with teeth bared, but:

is quite dead: Toby is snarling at the corpse of the  TEENAGE BOXER who lost his bout against Julius. He's  still in his boxing shorts...BUT JASON'S SPLINTERY POOL  CUE HAS BEEN STABBED THROUGH HIS CHEST.

location: ON RENNIE AND MISS VAN DEUSEN

text: as they walk along the edge of the pool.
So, are you having fun yet?
(lying)
Yeah...a lot.
I seem to detect a hint of  ingenuousness in your tone. (beat)
In other words, level with me.
(a pause)
There's something I haven't told  you... ...But before she can begin the next sentence, Rennie is  shoved from behind.
as she SPLASHES INTO THE POOL'S DEEP END.
spins around, seeing Tamara standing there with Eva.
Wow, sorry...
flounders at the surface, nobody realizing the terror  she's experiencing. She's too scared to even cry for  help.
isn't looking at Rennie, her attention on admonishing  Tamara.
Why on earth would you do something  like that?
It was an accident, I swear... Eva avoids eye contact, feeling awful. Sean comes walking up, seeing Rennie.
What happened? (to Rennie)
Rennie, are you okay?

She's can't even hear Sean, her vision being splashed by  the chlorinated water. She sinks under the surface,  turning around...AND COMING FACE TO FACE WITH YOUNG  JASON. The eight year-old corpse GRABS HER ANKLE AND  TRIES TO DRAG HER DOWN.
as Rennie sinks under the surface, all alone, thrashing  in terror.
realizes she's in trouble. He immediately dives in after  her, pulling her to the pool's edge, where Miss Van  Deusen helps to lift her out.
quickly move on.
That was truly excellent.
(feels like shit)
Yeah.
Time to check out the waiters.
I think I'll pass. See you later,  okay?
But...wait a minute! Eva walks away. Tamara acts angry, but deep down she's  hurt.
Some friend you are.
as Sean climbs from the pool to join Miss Van Deusen, who is trying to comfort Rennie.
(to Sean)
Bring her a towel, okay? Sean nods, hurrying off as others start to crowd around.  Miss Van Deusen looks up at them.
She's fine -- everybody go back to  what you were doing. They disperse. Rennie slowly starts to cry, holding tight to her teacher.
Care to talk about it? After a moment to compose herself...
I can't swim.
I gathered that. Rennie says nothing else. Miss Van Deusen knows she's  holding out.
I had a skiing accident in high  school, broke my left leg. It took  three winters before I would even look  at the snow again...but the solution  kept eluding me. (beat)
I finally took lessons. I've never  broken a bone since.
It's not that simple.
Maybe not. But you're not telling me  everything, are you?
(long pause)
Whenever I get near the water, I see  this young boy drowning. He tries to  pull me down with him. The teacher didn't expect this, taking a thoughtful  pause.
When did this start?
About four years ago...at Crystal  Lake. I spent a few summers there with  Uncle Charles inbetween boarding  school.
After your parents passed away? Rennie nods somberly.
Did you have an accident in the lake?
No. It was just a normal summer. I've  never been able to figure it out.

Only one young boy ever drowned in  that lake, and that was before you  were even born. His name was Jason  Voorhees. The name has triggered some deep memory...but the  recollection vanishes upon the sound of her uncle's  voice.
Dear God...
as McCulloch rushes over to Rennie, seeing that she's  soaked. He's livid.
She's fine, Charles. Take it easy...
Oh, I can see that. You've done a  wonderful job of supervising the kids,  Miss Van Deusen.
It wasn't her fault. He gets Rennie to her feet just as Sean runs back with a  towel. McCulloch grabs it from him, wrapping it around  his niece, facing both Miss Van Deusen and Sean.
Stay away from her...both of you. He starts to lead her away. The crazy DECK HAND blocks  their path, slipping his flask away.
He's come back and you're all going to  die. Rennie gazes at the Deck Hand, then back at McCulloch.
Just...leave me alone... She pulls away from him, hurrying off, confused and  frightened. McCulloch's retinas pierce the Deck Hand with scorn. He checks his watch, then storms off.
as a loud, firm KNOCK punctuates the silence. Then comes  a sultry voice...
The door's open. McCulloch swings it open.
I'm in no mood for any more stall  tactics, Miss Mason. Where is your  final project?
as Tamara fills a pair of champagne glasses with a bottle of Dom Perignon. She's wearing a full body robe.
Wouldn't you like a glass of champagne  first, Charles? He's about to lose his temper. McCulloch steps closer.
Where did you get that alcohol?
I packed it. Just for us.
as we approach Tamara's porthole window, peering through  it. We can't hear the words but we can clearly see the  people.
as McCulloch takes the bottle from her, setting it down  on her nightstand.
That's it. You're not setting foot off  this ship until we return home.
But I haven't even shown you my  biology project... Tamara unties her robe. PAN DOWN to the floor with it as  it softly piles at her bare feet.
as the SHADOW OUTSIDE quickly blurs past the window.

McCulloch is flabbergasted, too stunned to fully react.  Tamara is wearing a layered teddy, which she's beginning  to unsnap, exposing her lithe body...but that's not all.  Tamara has drawn all her major organs on her bare skin.
Take a closer look, Charles. I want to  make sure I labeled all my organs  correctly.

as we approach her door, still cracked open from  McCulloch's entrance. We get there just in time to see  Tamara slip her arms around McCulloch, planting her lips  on his, pressing her nubile flesh up against his stiffly  starched shirt.
as she holds him tight. He finally breaks away in a fit  of anger.
Oh, you've done it now. Not only are  you going home, I'll see to it that  you spend next year back in a high  school classroom! He storms for the door, swinging it open, coming face to  face with:
who casually lowers his camcorder.
I don't think so, Mr. McCulloch. (to Wayne)
Did you get anything good? His eyes are unable to leave her nakedness.
Oh yeah. She quickly slips on her robe again, all business.  McCulloch realizes what has just transpired.
You'll never get away with it. (eyeing Wayne)
And you can forget about ever  attending any film school. (serious beat)
You're both going to be very, very  sorry. He storms off. Wayne looks very, very nervous. Tamara  steps over to him, cuddling up.
Relax, Wayne. He won't risk doing a  thing. (beat)
Can I have the tape? He pops the eject button, absently handing it over. Wayne steps into her room, nervous and excited to be there. He  lifts the glass of champagne she poured for McCulloch.
This is going to sound supremely  lame...but I've had the major hots for  you since our sophomore year, Tamara. He gulps down the fizz. She forces a smile, stashing the  incriminating videotape.
That's sweet, Wayne. Look, I'd love to  chat but I'm really pressed for time. (ushering him to door)
Let's try to get together later, okey- doke?
But I thought...
Thanks for the camerawork. And out he goes, the door shut in his face. Wayne stands  outside her room, realizing he's a major chump.
Wayne, you're an asshole. He despondently exits.
as Tamara heads for the bathroom, slipping off her robe.  She moves to the shower curtain and we're right behind  her. Her hand reaches up, grabbing the curtain, yanking  it back... Nothing is there.

as Rennie enters, her eyes reddened. She moves to the  sink, looking at herself in the mirror. So much for the  silk blouse and satin pants, not to mention her soaked  hair. Rennie runs some warm water, rinsing her face. When she starts to fill her hands a second time, BLOOD  POURS OUT THE FAUCET INSTEAD OF WATER. Rennie gasps,  jerking up and seeing YOUNG JASON REFLECTED ON THE OTHER  SIDE OF THE MIRROR, SPLASHING IN WATER.
It's not real, it's not real...
as water from the shower head SPLASHES CAMERA for a beat  before Tamara turns it off.

as Tamara reaches for her robe, slipping it on. Her body  paint has been washed off.  She steps from the shower, glancing in her vanity mirror  AND SEEING THE REAL JASON REFLECTED IN IT. Tamara spins  around, looking face to face with JASON IN HER BATHROOM.  Just as she SCREAMS:
Young Jason reaches out to grab Rennie, HIS FIST CRASHING THROUGH THE MIRROR. Right when Rennie SCREAMS:
The real Jason SHATTERS TAMARA'S VANITY MIRROR WITH HIS  FIST. He grabs a sharp chunk of it, advancing on a  whimpering Tamara.
Please...please don't... Jason raises the shard above her and just as she  SHRIEKS...
as it blasts loudly in the bleak stormy night. It begins  to rain.
as Rennie comes rushing out, right into the arms of.  Sean. She clings to him, sobbing as the rain falls over  them.
It's okay...you're going to be okay.
I want to go home. I want off this  ship. After a moment...
Me too. (beat)
Let's go talk to my Dad. He puts his arm around her, leading her toward the  bridge.
as wind and rain pummel the bridge window.. Admiral  Robertson turns to his Chief Engineer.
Let's kick in the stablilizers, Mr.  Carlson, and get the seas off the  quarter. These kids are in for one  hell of a storm.
Yes Sir. Activating comfort cruise  mode. The Chief Engineer moves to a bank of toggle switches,  flipping a row of them.
as a bloodstained HAND silently removes the rusty  harpoon hanging above the map.
gets a reflective look in his weary eyes.
How olds your boy now, Carlson?
Nineteen months.

A tremendous age. Take some advice  from a salty old man: don't push him  too hard. The Chief Engineer nods with a sympathetic smile as the  Admiral steps off the bridge, onto the stormy deck,  contemplating the sea. The Chief Engineer moves to the  radio/intercom console. He lifts a telephone, punching in a three digit number. PUSH IN TIGHT ON HIS FACE.

This is the bridge. Approaching  weather suggests we secure the main  deck and... His sentence is sharply cut off, his head jerking from  excruciating, instant pain.  His mouth contorts with words no one will ever hear as he stares into the face of:
holding the opposite end of the harpoon. He shoves it  forward with one more staccato jerk and:
-- The harpoon's bloody, corroded tip pierces through  his once-white uniform.
returns to the bridge as LIGHTNING flashes outside.

Better have them doublecheck the  lifeboat stations as well... Admiral Robertson stops cold upon the sight of Mr.  Carlson. He hurries over to him, kneeling down, freezing  as a pair of MUDDY FEET ENTER FRAME. Admiral Robertson  bends his neck upwards to face:
hovering over him, now clutching one of the scaling  knives.
as Sean and Rennie walk up the corridor leading to the  bridge.
Can he really take us home?
Not completing a voyage is against  everything he stands for. But I think  I can convince him to call a Coast  Guard cutter for you.
What about you?
If I go with you, he'll never speak to me again. (beat)
But I'm never going to live up to his  expectations anyway...so maybe it's  the right thing to do. He's made a big decision. Sean takes her hand as they  walk on.
moving closer and closer to the bridge door, having not  the slightest inclination of what's in store for them.
knocks on the bridge door. No answer. He's confused. He  pushes the door open but something is blocking it. Sean  puts his weight into it, shoving hard.
as the door slides open, Sean stepping inside. His eyes  roil downwards upon seeing THE DEAD CHIEF ENGINEER, THE  HARPOON PROTRUDING FROM HIS BLOODY CHEST.

Oh Jesus...Dad?? Sean looks over at the helm...where his father is still  sitting in the swivel chair, his back to them. Silent.  Sean sidesteps the Chief Engineer's corpse, moving toward his father as Rennie remains frozen in shock.
Slowly walking toward Admiral Robertson...at least he  thinks it's his dad because he's unable to see his  face. Is it Jason now wearing the uniform?? When he's  about two feet away from him...

reaches out and swivels the chair around. It is his  father BUT HIS THROAT HAS BEEN SLIT. Sean staggers  backwards, uncomprehending, his senses overloaded. We  MOVE with him until he's backed into Rennie, clutching  onto him tightly.
He's...he's dead...
as Miss Van Deusen steps up to Rennie's door, gently  knocking.
Ronnie? I just came by to see how you  were feeling... No answer. She knocks harder...and it creaks open,  unlocked.
Rennie...? Suddenly the door is jerked from her grasp and swung  open. MCCULLOCH is standing on the other side of it.
I thought I told you to stay away from  her.
(holds her ground)
Where is she?
(accusing)

That's a very good question and I'd  appreciate an answer. A LOUD BUZZER blares out of an intercom speaker next to  their heads, causing the teachers to both jump. Sean's  unsteady voice immediately follows.
Attention everybody, attention. This  is Sean Robertson...
Miles is toweling off under the shelter of a gazebo as  Sean's voice blares out of a rain-pounded megaphone  speaker nearby.
There's been... (swallows)
What I mean is, this is an  emergency... Miles knows he can't be joking around. Wayne comes  walking by, covering his camcorder with his jacket.
Miles -- have you seen J.J.? She was  supposed to be jamming down in the  power room but... Miles gestures for him to be quiet, listening very  worriedly.
Repeat, this is an emergency...
as JULIUS and two other senior boys finish dressing after a shower, hearing Sean's words reverberate around them.
I want everybody to meet on the  bridge...
What the fuck is this? The others shrug, concerned.
The wooden shuffleboard disks are drowning in  precipitation. Eva stands alone in the rain, staring at  the court as Sean's voice continues.
Stay calm, but get here as quick as  possible. Walk with a friend if you  can... Eva wipes the rain from her face, then walks away.
trying his best to keep it together. He glances at his  dead father, still unable to believe it.

God, I wish this was a joke, but it's  not. Sean slowly puts down the phone. He's lost in a daze.  Suddenly the SHIP LURCHES, a huge swell SPLASHING THE  BRIDGE WINDOW. Admiral Robertson's body falls from the  swivel chair.
What is happening??? Sean regains his balance, moving to the computer console, looking at the OMEGA and LORAN like he's never seen them  before.
I don't know...we've gone off course  or something...
What do you mean??? Another wave hammers the bow. She's in a state of awful  panic.

I don't know what I mean! All's I know  is that there's no one guiding this  ship anymore... Sean is starting to lose it. The fear of the ocean  guiding her, Rennie rushes to him, gripping and shaking  him.
Can't you call for help?? Sean tries to get a grip and assess the situation, pacing frenetically.
I think so. But we have to lower the  anchors so we don't drift any  further...
Where are they?
The bow...front of the ship. There's a  hoist on each side that lowers them She starts to exit.
I didn't mean for you to go!
Just radio for help, okay??? She hurries out the door, working on terror-induced  adrenaline. Sean rushes to the radio console, depressing  the keying button, speaking into the mike.
Mayday, mayday, mayday...
as JULIUS arrives with the others from the locker room.  They react to the dead bodies while Sean continues at the radio.
Please...can anybody out there hear  me?? No response. WAYNE and MILES rush in.
Sean, what's going on? Then he sees the corpses. He needs no further answer.
Jesus Christ... He's too scared to even videotape it. Sean is bombarded  with questions as he tries to figure out the radio.
Who did this, man?
Is the radio even working??
Isn't there some international S.O.S.  thing you can do???
(suddenly remembers)
Channel 16...the distress frequency... (dialing knob)
Mayday, mayday, mayday...this is the  Princess Ruby. Please, somebody  answer...
as a COAST GUARD CUTTER tracks through stormy seas.
This is Coast Guard cutter Dallas.  What is the nature of your problem,  Ruby?
as they hear the voice, reacting, relieved and thrilled.
The Captain and Chief Engineer...  they've been...they're dead.
(a grave-pause)
What is your location?
I...I don't know...
Is your ship equipped with Omega  satellite navigation or LORAN?
Yes...
The LORAN has a digital printout of  your latitude and longitude. Give me  the coordinates and we'll be there as  quick as we can. Sean hurries to the LORAN, reading the numbers.
as LIGHTNING STRIKES above it in the night sky. Camera  slowly ADJUSTS to find the RADIO ANTENNA CABLE. A second  later, JASON'S HAND REACHES FOR IT, GETTING A FIRM GRASP.
as Sean hurries back to the radio, pressing it against  his spitless mouth.
I've got the numbers.
Give me the degrees first, followed by  minutes and sec... Suddenly his voice is CUT OFF, followed by STATIC.
Hello? Are you there?? No response. A lump sinks into everyone's throat.
as Jason drops the cable he's just torn out, marching  onward.
as McCulloch bursts onto the bridge, followed by Miss Van Deusen.
I demand to know what is going on...
Oh dear God... She's seen the bodies. McCulloch follows her glance,  paling. He quickly takes charge, pushing through the  students.
Where's the radio?
It's...dead.
You're all going to die. All heads spin as the deranged DECK HAND treads out from  a shadowy corridor.
You're the last ones. He's come back  for you.
What are you talking about? The Deck Hand takes a final swig from his flask, dropping it with unsteady hands.
Jason Voorhees. There is a collective, disconcerting silence triggered by the infamous name.
You're insane, old man. Jason Voorhees  has been dead for over thirty years.
He walks this ship, here and now.

A killer walks this ship indeed. And  it's certainly none of us... The crazed old man gets his drift. Everyone looks at him  suspiciously. McCulloch grabs a SCALING KNIFE off the  wall, taking a step towards him.
You're the one who's insane!! The raving man flees back the way he came. McCulloch  raises the flare gun; Miss Van Deusen grabs McCulloch's  arm, stopping him.
What are you doing??
That lunatic has been spouting off  about Jason since we boarded...  (eyeing bodies)
It's no coincidence.
But that doesn't prove that he's the  one!
Walking corpses are not real!
Yeah, well these dead bodies are sure  enough real. (to the others)
I say we regroup and find this  motherfucker before he finds us.  There's a murmur; it makes sense.
You'll do no.such thing and watch your  mouth, young man! I'm in charge here! They all look at McCulloch defiantly.
School's out, McCulloch. (to the others)
Let's go. Julius walks off the bridge; all the seniors follow  except Sean.
Please everybody, stay here!! They don't listen. McCulloch starts to go after  them...and then it hits him:
Christ...where's Rennie??
She's...she's dropping the anchors. I  thought the Coast Guard could find us  easier if...
What?? You sent her out there with a  murderer running around loose??
as Rennie moves past wet, empty lounge chairs towards the bow. She passes a row of translucent windows. The first  three are normal...but the fourth has the SILHOUETTE OF
He begins to stride parallel to her, then disappears  when the windows end and a wall takes over.
as Julius and his followers continue on, passing Eva,  who's coming up from a staircase. She stops Wayne.
What's going on? I heard on the P.A.  system that...
(interrupting)
The Captain's been murdered. The buzz  is that Jason might be on board.
Jason...Voorhees? She knows the legend as weld as everybody else. Wayne  nods gravely, moving to catch up with the others. Eva  rushes up to him again.
Have you seen Tamara?
No. And I'm not losing any sleep over  it.
But she might be in trouble...
So what else is new? (beat)
Look Eva, you're asking the wrong dude  to feel sorry for Tamara Mason. Wise  up -- it's not hip to be her friend.
I don't care about being hip anymore. She means it. Wayne nods with understanding.
I'm sorry, but I've gotta find J.J. He hurries on.
as Rennie appears, fighting the wind and rain to get  closer to the anchor hoists.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH DECK WINDOW

text: --spying on Rennie like a wolf watching a lamb. We MOVE a few windows down, getting a better view of her.
deciding that the time is right to strike. His hand moves to the bow entrance door knob, slowly turning it, pulling it open.
moving closer to the right anchor hoist, her back to us  as well as Jason. She climbs behind the hoist, looking at the consoles. Then suddenly a BARK.
Toby? She turns, catching a glimpse of her dog running down the side of the deck. Rennie leaves the hoist, going after  Toby.
through the crack in the door, watching Rennie  unexpectedly take off. He's about to move after her when  ha hears:
Tamara? Are you around here anywhere? Jason quietly closes the door. Rennie will have to wait.
as she cautiously walks along, poking her head in every  alcove.
Tamara?
moving down the same corridor, catching a glimpse of Eva  before she turns a corner and disappears.
(STEADICAM)
Eva steps into the hallway outside Tamara's stateroom.  She walks up to Tamara's door, knocking on it. It swings  open, unlocked.
Tamara? (no response)

I just want to talk with you. She steps into Tamara's room and we go in with her. The  quarters are empty. Eva stands there for a beat, confused and scared. She's about to leave when a CREAKING SOUND  causes her to look back at:
It slowly swings open...splashing Eva's eyes with  grotesque multi-images of Tamara: SHE IS HANGING ON THE

head_text.subj: DOOR HOOK, HER BODY PIN-CUSHIONED WITH A DOZEN MIRROR

text: shrieks, running back out the door...
...and sliding to a abrupt halt because JASON IS STANDING AT THE END OF THE HALLWAY. He moves toward Eva like a  bulldozer. She turns a rapid 180 and sprints in retreat.
Gasping for oxygen, Eva has no time to even scream as she flees from the monster, erratically turning down a spiral staircase and running on.
chasing after her with the smooth determination of a  shark, never letting her get too far in the lead.
Empty for a second, then Eva appears, weaving her way  through a maze of corridors and passageways. She races  past a sign directing passengers to "CLUB RUBY."
--entering the same corridor a beat after Eva exits it in the direction of the disco. He tramples onward.

The thudding low frequency of a mesmerizing dance tune  precedes Eva as she tears open a door, entering the  corridor. MOVE BACKWARDS WITH HER as she rushes forward,  curving through the shallow passageway and emptying out  onto a high tech DISCO FLOOR. A flashing Star Wars  lighting system assaults her all directions along with  the music. She's all alone in here.
The lights strobing across her face only accentuate her  terror. She spots another door on a small stage, rushing  to it. It's locked.
as Jason enters the corridor, SLAMMING THE DOOR SHUT  BEHIND HIM.
decides this is the wrong place to be. She moves for the  corridor again and:
appears on the corridor steps for a brief second. The  spotlight goes black, then flashes on again. Now he's  gone.

backs away, sliding along the edge of the dance floor  like she's on a building ledge. Chaser lights and mirror  balls fondle her body as she moves as far away from the  point where she last saw him. But:
illuminates only ten feet from her, a crimson strobe  assaulting his hockey mask. She's on a collision course  with him.
whirls dizzily to the center of the dance floor upon the  sight of him. Camera SPINS with her in 360 degree arcs,  PUSHING IN on her face.
spiraling counter-clockwise on the dance floor, flashes  of Jason materializing where she least expects to see  him. And getting closer. Finally at the point of  exhaustion:
stops, looking everywhere.
He seems to be gone. She catches her breath...then  sensing his presence, she revolves a half-turn to face:
exploding under a pin spotlight, standing directly  before her. His forearms recoil with lightning speed as  he grips her throat...
Thundering music. Frantic lights. And Jason and Eva at  the center of it all. HER FEET ARE TWENTY-FOUR INCHES OFF

head_text.subj: THE GROUND, KICKING MADLY AS THE LIFE IS BEING CHOKED OUT

text: OF HER. Finally Eva's legs go rag doll limp. Jason flings her to the ground like a sack of flour. This dance is  over.
Rennie appears again, scanning her no-visibility  surroundings.
Toby? Where'd you go? No sign of her dog. She remembers her mission, heading to the anchors again.
as Rennie arrives on the bow, climbing into the left  hoist box behind the huge anchor cable.
moving up to the bow door like Jason did before, cracking it open, seeing Rennie from behind. And moving towards  her.
is oblivious as she reads the directions above the  controls.
as Rennie's hand grabs it, shoving it forward.
A moment later, her thumb finds it and depresses it.
as the massive black chain links thunder to life.
He's now within ten feet of the unaware girl.
remains in the hoist box, making certain it is operating  correctly. A second later, we see the fleeting outline of a HUMAN SHAPE appear behind her.
Three feet from Rennie. She spins around to climb out of  the hoist box and GASPS.
She's facing MCCULLOCH. He immediately reaches past her,  yanking the lever back to its center position, and:
grinds to a halt.
as McCulloch faces her, angrily grabbing Rennie's arms,  shouting over the storm.
You had me worried to death!
But Sean said...

I'm the one you should be listening  to! Do you think dropping an anchor in  the middle of a storm makes any sense  whatsoever? She tries to find some defense, but McCulloch leads her  off before any wards come forth.
as a pair of SKEET RIFLES, three FIRE AXES, a FLARE GUN  and several POOL CUES are dumped onto the foam padded  plastic.
where Julius has gathered his small group of vigilantes,  including Miles and Wayne.
I managed to scrounge this shit from  the game room and hallways. Grab what  you want. Wayne takes one of the rifles; Miles grabs the axe.
What are you taking, Julius?
(flexes fists)
Nothin'.
(dead serious)
We're talking the possibility of Jason  Voorhees here. Julius pauses. He's not stupid.
Nothin' but this gun. He reaches down, picking up the other rifle. And they  move.
as McCulloch guides his niece down the hallway, swinging  her door open.
Can't we at least talk about it?
I refuse to discuss this ridiculous  notion that a ghoul is terrorizing  this ship.
But what about the drowning boy I've  been seeing? He avoids eye contact. McCulloch takes her hand, ushering her across the threshold. She's standing inside her room  now; he's in the hallway.
Whatever you've been...imagining...  has nothing to do with Jason Voorhees. (pause)
I want you to be safe, Rennie. That's  all I care about.
I'm not staying in my room, Uncle  Charles.
This isn't a request. He closes the door on her face, pulling out a key,  locking the dead bolt. She pounds on it from the other  side.
Uncle Charles! He ignores her, briskly walking away.
as she throws her fists against the door a final time,  realizing it's futile.
Steam continues to seep from the maze of criss-crossing  pipes. Wayne appears on one of the catwalks. He's holding the skeet rifle under one arm, using the sun gun off his  video camera to guide him.
J.J. -- you down here?
as Wayne carefully lets his light guide him down the  precarious walkway. An unexpected blast of steam scares  the crap out of him, causing him to stumble.
--They slip off the bridge of his nose, skittering down  through the catwalk and pipes to God knows where.
lies helplessly on the metal grid work, realizing his  bleak predicament has just been squared. He pulls himself to a standing position again.
We got a major problem, Wayne.
His vision now gives him shadows and shapes rather than  crisp images. He raises the gun and continues unsteadily  forward.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH GRID WORK

text: as Wayne inches forward. Camera slowly PANS INTO A  PROFILE OF JASON, watching him from a catbird seat.
takes another step, almost tripping on a set of stairs  leading down to the next level. And when he arrives  there...

head_text.subj: ...A LARGE FIGURE STEPS OUT, HOLDING WHAT APPEARS TO BE A

text: instantly raises the rifle and FIRES...
...and the body goes down. He's hit him!
stands there, breathing some relief. He gets an idea,  looking through his camcorder eyepiece. Wayne begins to  adjust the eyepiece diaptor.

as the figure on the ground slips in and out of focus,  finally becoming crisp. WAYNE HAS SHOT A CREW MEMBER --  the same good looking one Tamara and Eva ogled earlier.  He's holding a screwdriver from his waist band tool set,  not a knife.
slowly lowers his camera as his heart rises into his  throat.
No... He raises his camcorder again, hoping a second view will  reveal a dead Jason rather than this young man.

He gets half his wish: a HOCKEY MASK NOW FILLS HIS  FRAME...but Jason is far from dead. Wayne catches a split second glimpse of Jason's fist coming towards him, then  the camera is KNOCKED FROM HIS EYE AND THE WORLD BECOMES  DARK AND BLURRY.

screams, blindly running as fast as he can. He trips,  picking himself up, stumbling down the catwalk stairs.  Wayne makes it about ten feet before he stumbles over  something, bringing with it a harsh strum from an  ELECTRIC GUITAR.
Sure enough, his left shoe is resting on the pickups of a blood-streaked Gibson Flying V.
--sprawled out on the metal floor. He gropes around, his  hands feeling something. It sends chills from his groin  up through his scalp.
No no no...
Wayne's hands are touching J.J.'S BLOODY FACE, A LARGE  CRACK IN HER SKULL. He doesn't have time to scream or cry because
hoists him off of J.J.'s body and flings him into:
which shorts out with a fanfare of ELECTRICAL SPARKS  AND FIRE, INSTANTLY FRYING WAYNE.

as the overhead lights briefly flicker, then resume  normal operation. Sean stands opposite the navigational  chart, ping-ponging between it and the ship's  computers as Miss Van Deusen paces nervously.
What was that??
(very worried)
I don't know.
(trying not to panic)
What happens if we don't get control  of the ship, Sean? I want you to tell  me the truth.
(beat)
We could hit a reef, collide with  another ship...we could be out here  for weeks before anybody spotted us. They are suddenly jolted with a DOOR SLAM as McCulloch  storms onto the bridge.
Did you find Rennie?
She's locked safe in her room, no  thanks to either of you. (like Sean isn't even in the  room)
Has he brought it back on course yet? Sean doesn't look at him, still trying to assimilate the  wall of components.
He's doing the best he can, Charles.

He's the son of the Captain, for  Chrissakes. You'd think he'd be able  to operate this thing! Sean closes his eyes, trying to keep from losing his mind and temper. A fierce WAVE slaps the windows in front of  Sean's face, motivating him to get his shit together. He  checks the Omega and LORAN.
Well? Sean doesn't answer, moving to the seat behind the helm.  His father's seat. Sean takes the chair, adjusting the  wheel, watching the compass. He studies a series of  buttons on the console.

We PAN across them, stopping on one labeled "FIRE ALARM - DO NOT BREAK EXCEPT IN CASE OF EMERGENCY." Camera  continues around to find we are in the POWER ROOM, NOT on the bridge. Our vision suddenly lands on JASON, staring  at the alarm button, considering. He glances back over  his shoulder.
Wayne's body is NOW ON FIRE...AND THE BLAZE IS SPREADING  THROUGH THE ROOM.
as Sean makes up his mind, flipping several toggle  switches.
as Sean flips the last toggle and a green light  illuminates, indicating the AUTO PILOT is in effect.
It worked...we're back on course! Sean feels his confidence instantly rejuvenated. Miss Van Deuten immediately embraces him. But a fraction of time  later:
Jason's fist SMASHES the alarm button...
...and a LOUD SIREN cries out across the entire vessel.  The blood drains from Sean's face.
What's that?
The fire alarm...
as the shrieking alarm assaults the main deck, hallways  and corridors, giving Julius, Miles and Wayne deep  pause for thought.

as the alarm bombards Rennie's ears like everybody  else's. She hurries to her curtained porthole window,  working up the energy to look outside. Rennie gets a grip on them, FLINGING THEM OPEN. The DECK HAND'S CRAZED FACE  IS GAZING BACK AT HER. Rennie screams; a second later he  hurries off.
as McCulloch tears open a cabinet door labeled EMERGENCY  FLARE GUN. The siren continues to blast.
Can you shut that damn thing off?? Sean moves to a bank of switches, his eyes darting around for the appropriate switch. Miss Van Deusen sees  McCulloch remove the FLARE GUN from the cabinet.
We already thought of that -- nobody  could possibly see it in this storm...
There's only one person who needs to  see it. And I'm going to find him.
What about the fire??
I doubt very much that one even  exists.
What are you talking about?
Use some common sense! Setting off a  fire alarm causes panic...the same  kind of panic caused by suggesting  Jason Voorhees is on board. (resolved)
Enough is enough.  He marches out the door. Sean finds the alarm kill  switch, flipping it. The excruciating siren vanishes. He  grabs a pair of rain jackets, tossing one to Miss Van  Deusen.
We have to get everybody together just  in case the fire's for real. Sean heads for the door, shoving it forward.
as it slams open...and JULIUS steps out, not Sean, from a different deck door. TRACK with him as he treads along  the side of the ship, skeet rifle raised.
walking past the lifeboat stations, the wind and  precipitation battering the small boats. With no warning, AN OBSCURE FIGURE LEAPS OUT, GRIPPING AN AXE.
shoves the gun stock into his shoulder and takes  instantaneous aim...but he doesn't shoot. He slowly  lowers the rifle.
as MILES lowers the axe. They've just scared the shit out of each other.
I'll take the upper deck. Julius nods. They separate. Neither boy notices the  smoke which is starting to emerge from a deck vent...
Filled with black smoke. The fire is spreading  dangerously close to a series of hoses attached to a fuel pump, leading to tanks below. A sign over them reads:  DANGER - FUEL TANKS.
--steaming and far from calm as the weather blitzes it.  Miles appears, climbing a ladder to the upper deck level.
Someone is spying on Miles from below, watching his every step.
as Miles arrives, axe raised. He pauses to regard his  surroundings, then moves on. RACK FOCUS TO FIND JASON  RIGHT BEHIND HIM, having followed Miles up the stairs.

Only darkness and rain for a beat, then Miles  materializes, curving around the gargantuan smokestack.  He passes us and we SWING AROUND, now looking at the back of his head. He takes three more steps and JASON STEPS  INTO THE FOREGROUND. Miles senses his presence and JERKS

head_text.subj: AROUND, RAISING THE AXE, BRINGING IT DOWN ON JASON'S

text: ...but Jason easily grabs the axe handle before it makes  contact, flinging it away.
He's pacing along when a clattering noise from above  makes him stop. Suddenly MILES' AXE THUDS INTO THE  MAHOGANY DECK NEXT TO HIS FOOT. Julius gazes at it,  jerking his head upward.
Miles?? His answer is a LOUD CRACK OF LIGHTNING. At the same  time:
He's scrambling as fast as he can across the slippery  deck as the monster relentlessly pursues him.
He's having no problem catching up to the defenseless  teenager.
as Julius zooms up them to aid his comrade.
as Miles slides up to the mast and begins scaling it. He  glances downward and sees:
Jason is right at his heels.
slips on a rung, regains control, and continues upward.  He makes it three more steps, almost at the uppermost  point when JASON GRABS THE BACK OF HIS COAT, TEARING HIM  OFF THE MAST.
Miles cries out as he FREEFALLS BACKWARDS, somersaulting  and twisting like he's doing one of his better dives...
...Empty space for a half-second, then MILES' FACE JOLTS  INTO FRAME with a look of ultimate agony. Something has  abruptly stopped his fall. Something quite fatal.
coming around a corner, stopping dead in his tracks, his  stomach wrenching as his eyes fall on:
...who is staring right back at him with dead pupils.  MILES HAS BEEN HORRIBLY IMPALED OM A SHIP FLAGPOLE.
doesn't get the chance to grasp the reality of it because

head_text.subj: JASON'S HAND GRIPS HIS SHOULDER, SPINS HIM AROUND AND

text: SLUGS HIM SQUARELY IN THE FACE. The force of it sends the boxer REELING BACKWARDS OFF THE RAILING...
...and Julius SPLASHES INTO THE ROUGH SEA. He's quickly  swallowed by the torrential waters.

as Rennie's HAND jiggles her doorknob again, confirming  that it's locked tight. RISE to find her desperate face;  she begins furiously pacing and we DOLLY BEHIND HER  ...but Rennie stops cold upon hearing:
Hhhhelp....me.... Rennie whirls into a CLOSE UP, staring with disbelief at:

...who is standing on the oval rug in her stateroom, his  hands reaching out to her. But then comes the  inexplicable: THE OVAL RUG TURNS INTO LAKE WATER AND  JASON SINKS INTO IT. He's drowning in the middle of her  room, choking on murky water.
Hhhhelp me....I'm drowning...
stands frozen, feeling herself drawn to him like a  magnet. She crawls to the edge of her rug, which is now a deep lake, and extends her arms to him.
grabs her hand, pulling hard, then grinning wide.
feels the skin on her face crawling off her skull, her  eyes expanding because she's now looking at:
Rennie is holding onto herself, about four years younger  in a bathing suit, drowning in the lake. YOUNG RENNIE.
Hhhhelp....me....
screams with guttural fear, letting go of herself,  watching her younger self drown in the hole in her room.
disappears under the surface of the water...which seconds later CHANGES BACK INTO HER OVAL RUG.

as Rennie moves away, tears rolling down her face,  utterly confused. She backs against the wall next to her  porthole window and THE REAL JASON'S FIST SMASHES THROUGH THE WINDOW, GRABBING HER THROAT. Rennie struggles,  gasping for air as he attempts to strangle her.
groping for a weapon to stop him, her fingers skittering  across her table like a spider.
Her head is pulled taut against the wall just below the  porthole, with Jason's hideous mask framed in the  circular shattered window. She's slowly dying.

Her movements slow as the oxygen leaves her system. But  Rennie's fingers miraculously find a recognizable object: the ink-dip pen given to her by Miss Van Deusen. She  seizes it, getting a firm grip.
as Rennie JABS THE PEN BACKWARDS, SENDING THE SHARP  INSTRUMENT THROUGH THE EYEHOLE OF HIS MASK. Jason  instantly releases her, reeling backwards.
sinks to the floor, scrambling on all fours to get as far away from the porthole as possible. She makes it across  the room to her stateroom door just as:
is SLAMMED OPEN FROM THE OTHER SIDE. She shrieks in  terror but it's SEAN who is standing there.
Rennie...??
(pointing)
The window... Sean rushes to the shattered porthole, looking out,  seeing nothing. He steps back to her.
I don't understand what is happening  to me... She breaks down; he holds her.
It's gonna be okay...
...but Sean couldn't be more wrong. The flames are  lapping at the fuel pump and hoses, furiously burning  down into the tank. A second later the whole thing  EXPLODES IN A BALL OF FIRE.
as a huge HOLE is blown through the thick steel hull:
The ship noticeably rocks from the explosion. Rennie  clings to him fearfully.
What is it?? One second later, the lights begin to flicker.
The power room...
as huge amounts of water rush in from a gaping hole in  the hull.
as the overhead lights flicker over McCulloch. There's  some fear mixed with the anger as he grips his flare gun, moving onward.

head_text.subj: PONT OF VIEW FROM KITCHEN OVENS

text: Someone is crouched behind a massive convection oven,  spying on McCulloch.

almost flinches when the lights die and he's plunged  into blackness. He moves forward, every step tentative.  He passes the convection ovens and we REMAIN on them,  spotting the frightened face of the DECK HAND in the  shadows. The deranged old man is very sober now,  clutching a LARGE KITCHEN KNIFE for defense.
Sean paces feverishly in the blackness of her room,  trying to think, talking to himself.
Rule one, don't panic. Rule two,  assess the damage and act  accordingly...
Is the ship going to sink?? He returns to Rennie, the panic settling back in.
I don't know. Her ultimate fear is staring her straight in the face.  Suddenly the dim blue lights flicker on.
The emergency lights just kicked in... Sean makes Rennie look into his eyes. His words are meant to convince himself as much as Rennie.
We'll be okay. I want you to wait by  the lifeboats, just in case.
(terrified)
I'm not going near any lifeboat!
But Rennie...
I'm not!!
as Miss Van Deusen gathers a handful of students who are  panicking, sitting them down.

Everybody wait right here until I come  back with the others -- understand? They nod, frightened to death. She dashes away, carrying  us into a view of the dining room windows. No one  notices the SILHOUETTE OF JASON passing by on the outside desk.
Sea water is pouring into the ship's motors. Clouds of  steam and black smoke fill the room as the engine  bearings begin to GRIND.
as McCulloch rushes up to Rennie's already open door,  cautiously entering with flare gun raised.
Rennie??

The room is empty, shards of the porthole glass scattered across her rug. He steps over to it, bringing his head up to the gaping hole, peering outside. We wait for his  attack...but it doesn't come. McCulloch's eyes take us to something across the room. The bathroom door is afar.

cautiously steps up to the door, silently grabbing the  knob and SWINGING IT OPEN. It's empty. He hears  something, spinning around. Again, nothing is there.  McCulloch quickly moves to the telephone and dials. A few seconds pass.
Come on, answer!!
TIGHT on the bridge telephone, ringing repeatedly. RISE  TO FIND JASON, ignoring the phone, scrutinizing the deck  below through rain-streaked windows.
Miss Van Deusen is darting across the deck, gathering up  a trio of terrified seniors.
Jason methodically moves to the bank of switches,  studying them.
In large, unmistakable letters over a red button are the  words "ABANDON SHIP ALARM." He flips back the plastic  safety cover, exposing the button.

A horrible grinding sound echoes through the narrow  corridor. Sean and Rennie appear at the opposite end,  coughing on the black smoke which clouds their  passageway. Sean looks down, seeing that they are  standing in a puddle of water.
Water has gotten to the engines. (coughs)
We have to get everybody off this  ship...
as Jason presses it with firm deliberation, and:
A WHOOPING SIREN blasts through the passageway. Sean and  Rennie have no time to react because:
A sealed compartment door EXPLODES OPEN WITH THE PRESSURE OF SEA WATER...
...and a WALL OF WATER ENGULFS.RENNIE AND SEAN, KNOCKING  THEM DOWN. Sean fights to pull her up, but not in time  for her to witness:
which bobs up in front of her. Rennie cries out,  scrambling to grab onto Sean as what's left of Wayne's  body washes past them.
as a door opens and Miss Van Deusen guides a half-dozen  SENIORS over to the LIFEBOAT STATIONS.
(shouting over storm)
Everybody climb in! They follow her orders as the Abandon Ship alarm wretches on. But little do they know that:
Someone is briskly moving towards the group and Miss Van  Deusen. Just as we are within a few feet of her...
--It's MCCULLOCH who's approached them. He grabs Miss Van Deusen, shaking her violently.
What did you do with Rennie??
Nothing! I went to her cabin and... McCulloch rushes off before she can finish. Miss Van  Deusen turns back to the other kids, helping them into  the boat.
Everybody hurry...please...
