We slowly DOLLY BACKWARDS until Miles' AXE comes into  frame, still stuck in the mahogany decking. A beat, then  JASON'S HALAL DISLODGES IT FROM THE WOOD.
as Sean climbs up from below, soaked to the bone, pulling up a half-conscious Rennie. Sean carries her around a  corner, where he collides with McCulloch. McCulloch  pulls Rennie away from him.
She never should've set foot on this  ship. This is your fault!
This is Jason's fault!
(shouting)
Not another word, do you hear me??
as Miss Van Deusen throws the "down" lever and the  lifeboat hoist begins to lower the boat. Camera SLOWLY

head_text.subj: CREEPS IN A SEMI-CIRCLE AS A SILHOUETTED FIGURE STEPS
INTO A POOL OF LIGHT BEHIND HER. JASON.

text: One of the students screams, the others clinging together upon the sight of this infamous monster. But the boat is  already over the edge, past the point of return. And  lowering at a snail's pace.
turns to see JASON APPROACHING THEM WITH AXE RAISED. She  backs away but Jason ignores her, heading directly for  the hoist. He arches back with his weapon and SLICES  DOWNWARD.
as Jason's axe CHOPS THE CABLE IN TWO, and:
The bow cable SNAPS, DUMPING THE HALF DOZEN TEENAGERS  INTO THE TURBULENT SALT WATER. They last about five  seconds before succumbing to a drowning death.
sees it all, her intestines constricting in agonizing  knots. She summons all her rationale and sends it down to her legs, running away as fast as she can.

head_text.subj: MISS VAN DEUSEN'S POINT OF VIEW

text: --knocking down deck tables, chairs and chaise lounges as she flees. The creative writing teacher swerves around a  column, heading for an interior door, sliding to a stop  as it BANGS OPEN IN FRONT OF HER. McCulloch steps  outside, carrying Rennie, with Sean right behind her.  Rennie is conscious now, squirming free of her uncle upon the sight of Miss Van Deusen.
as Rennie rushes into Miss Van Deusen's arms. The teacher holds her, beginning to cry herself.
Why aren't you with the others,  woman?? Finally the message comes forth:
Jason...he has an axe... His face grows taut with anger.
Jason Voorhees is dead!! A PRIMAL SCREAM OF AGONY immediately cries out behind  them, the words unintelligible. They turn around to  witness THE DECK HANG STAGGERING TOWARDS THEM, GRIPPING
raises the flare gun with zero hesitation and FIRES IT...
...and the charge EXPLODES INTO HIS CHEST. He stands  there with his chest smoldering, almost like a gargoyle  in effigy. A second later the poor old man falls forward, and:
They all see that JASON'S AXE HAS BEEN BURIED IN HIS  BACK.
McCulloch gazes with utter disbelief.
Dear Christ...
We have to get off this ship!! They back away from the horrid sight and begin to run,  the Abandon Ship alarm still attacking their ears.
as McCulloch, Miss Van Deusen, Rennie and Sean scramble  to the closest lifeboat.
Everybody in -- I'll get the hoists McCulloch has no time for politeness, moving to the  lifeboat ahead of the women. Rennie stops cold, gazing  classy-eyed at the small boat.
Come on, sweetheart -- get in... But she doesn't budge. McCulloch levels wild eyes on her, quickly climbing back down.
Get in the boat, Rennie!
I...I can't...
(shaking her)
You can and you will!! He tries to slap her out of it, dragging her over to the  boat, ignoring her terror-stricken frenzy.
Stop it!!
Leave her alone, Charles! Miss Van Deusen quickly moves to a hysterical Rennie and  holds her, eyeing McCulloch vehemently.
as rain begins to wash the blood from his back. JASON'S  FOOT TRUDGES INTO FRAME...then his HAND REACHES DOWN,  RETRIEVING HIS AXE FROM THE DECK HAND'S SPINE.
as Rennie clings to         Miss Van Deusen, crying.

It's the only way, Rennie. Let's get  in the boat now, okay? Please...for  me? Rennie finds herself nodding. Miss Van Deusen helps the  trembling girl up the steps, an angered McCulloch right  behind.
as Rennie climbs over the boat edge, RECOILING AT THE  SOUND OF A SNARLING DOG. Toby is curled up in the  corner of the lifeboat, teeth bared.
Toby... She climbs in, moving to her equally, relieved dog,  McCulloch and Miss Van Deusen right behind her.
as Sean jabs it and the hoist motor kicks in.
just as a huge BOLT OF LIGHTNING cracks over the smoke  stack and upper deck. JASON steps out from behind it,  gaping down on them with frightening omnipresence.  Gripping the bloody axe.
Sean climbs in the boat as it continues to lower. He  takes one look back at the ship and sees:
rapidly moving down the staircase towards them. Sean's  view is CUT OFF as the lifeboat sinks below deck level.
as Sean's eyes dart around, down to the sea, up at the  hoist.
Come on...faster....
trampling towards the hoist, about thirty feet away now.  The boat has already disappeared over the edge.
as the lifeboat continues to lower, about ten feet from  making contact with the tumultuous ocean. The ship's hull is crooked and sinking.
as he relentlessly moves to the hoist cable, raising his  axe.
as the ship finally touches water, and:
Jason's axe blade CHOPS THE CABLE...
...and the hoist cable falls limply over them. Jason's  too late. Sean looks up and sees:
standing by the hoist, hovering over the edge. Very  angry.
grabs an oar, turning back to McCulloch.
Start rowing!! McCulloch takes the oar as Miss Van Deusen holds onto  Rennie tightly, the girl's eyes squeezed shut. Sean looks up at the ship again, and:
Jason is none.
Sean looks around with confusion as huge waves, wind and  rain pummel them.
He's gone...
...or is he? We're moving towards the lifeboat at water  level, almost like a shark preparing for attack.
Sean breathes with some relief, resuming his rowing with  McCulloch. They get about three strokes apiece before:
lunges from under the ocean surface, grabbing onto  Sean. Everybody SCREAMS...but it's JULIUS, gasping for  oxygen, spitting up seawater. Sean pulls him over the  edge.
It's Julius! Miss Van Deusen moves to help him and we:
The ship is gone now, the lifeboat a speck in the ocean.
The water is less rough now, the rain replaced with fog.  Julius has taken McCulloch's place behind an oar;  McCulloch is flanking his shivering niece with Miss Van  Deusen.
(miserable)
If we don't find the shore soon we're  all going to die. Sean tries to ignore him, keeping his mind on rowing.
(unable to hide fear)

Do you know where we are, Sean? Sean pauses, utterly exhausted. He thinks for a moment,  remembering his father's gift. Sean reaches into his coat pocket, removing the pocket navigational calculator. He  stares at it long and hard. Julius looks over at him,  seeing that Sean is on the verge of tears. He grips his  shoulder.
Hey man, if I can make it, so can.  you. Sean slowly nods, turning on the calculator.
as the lifeboat rows into frame, the water relatively  calm.

McCulloch, Rennie and Miss Van Deusen are asleep, Sean  and Julius rowing on sheer will power. Sean takes one  more stroke, feels himself passing out, then regains his  coherence again. Julius glances off the side of the ship  for no particular reason, then does a doubletake.

head_text.subj: JULIUS' POINT OF VIEW, (SECOND UNIT - N.Y.)

text: They are rowing right past THE STATUE OF LIBERTY,  illuminated in all its glory.
Julius feels his eyes widening and a huge smile taking  control of his haggard face. He tugs on Sean's sleeve,  his eyes never leaving the monument.
Hey man, wake up! Check it out!! The other stir as well, opening their eyes, not sure if  it's some kind of vision or if they are genuinely here.
God damn, we're in New York! You did  it, my man!! Julius howls with delight, Miss Van Deusen hugging Rennie as Julius gives Sean the high-five. Toby barks.

as the lifeboat rows toward the very famous skyline of  Manhattan, twinkling in the near distance. We can hear  the faint sound of Julius singing "New York, New York,"  relieved to be alive. They're going to make it.
as the sound of Julius' voice grows fainter. The water  begins to ripple...then the top half of a HOCKEY MASK

head_text.subj: BREAKS THE SURFACE FOR A BREATH OF AIR, SINKING AGAIN.

text: And swimming onward.
as Julius and Sean row the lifeboat up to a narrow barge  beneath deserted dock warehouses. They are not in the  safest part of town by a longshot.
as they climb onto the barge. Rennie breathes with relief as she steps off the boat. She takes a final glance back  at it and sees:
flailing her arms in the water right next to the  lifeboat, drowning.
Hhhhelp...me.... Suddenly a DECOMPOSED HAND REACHES UP FROM BELOW,  GRABBING HER, DRAGGING HER UNDER.
She gazes in utter shock, screaming:
No!!! They all follow her eyeline...but the water is calm,  nothing there.
(holding her)
It's okay...you're safe now... McCulloch grits his teeth.
Come on -- everybody up the ladder. He's the first one up. Sean looks at Rennie, concerned,  then hoists Toby up in his arms. They all begin climbing  the ladder.

as the last pair of feet disappear over the top edge of  the dock. Camera PANS back down the rungs, finding the  lifeboat and barge again. Suddenly JASON SPRINGS FROM THE WATER, CLIMBING ONTO THE BARGE. He gazes up at his new  surroundings, quite different from all the years he's  spent at Crystal Lake. But an item at the far end of the  dock causes him the longest pause...
A tattered billboard over one of the warehouses  advertises the NEW YORK RANGERS HOCKEY TEAM, featuring a  full shot of the HOCKEY-MASKED GOALIE.
looks at it long and hard. He tears off his life  preserver wits renewed ambition.
as Jason heads up the ladder. He's about to take  Manhattan.
as our survivors head into an isolated, foreboding group  of dock warehouses and alleys.
There must be a phone around here  somewhere.
A wonderful choice of places to dock a  boat, Mr. Robertson. Sean looks away, trying to keep from losing his temper.
We're spying on them from behind a stack of crates as  they come in our direction. Waiting for the right moment.
as they move towards the stack of crates. Without  warning, a PAIR OF GANG BANGERS JUMP OUT, BOTH HOLDING  GUNS. Nervous young druggies.
Hands up!!
Do it!! All hands go up. Gang Banger #2 grabs McCulloch's watch  and wallet, skimming through a wad of bills and credit  cards while #1 keeps them covered.
Got some good shit here, holmes.
(eyeing Rennie)
You got that right... He steps over to Rennie, brushing her hair back with the  barrel of his revolver, spotting the Statue of Liberty  pendant Sean gave her.
Now ain't that sweet. He tears it off her neck, pocketing it. Sean angrily  moves toward him and Gang Banger #l shoves the barrel  against Rennie's temple.

Go ahead, superman. Be a hero. Sean has no choice but to freeze. Julius flexes his  fists, but he too has Gang Banger #2's gun leveled on  him. McCulloch stares at the thugs with obvious contempt. It doesn't go unnoticed.

You got a problem, Dad? McCulloch offers some rare silence, shaking a "no" to the gun-toting kid. Rennie's dog-begins to growl, backing  away, ready to defend her. Gang Banger #1 points his  barrel at Toby with zero conscience, cocking back the  hammer.
No! She pushes his arm to the side just as the bullet  FIRES...
as the bullet tears up asphalt next to the dog's paws.  Toby sprints off into the darkness.
Gang Banger #1 grabs Rennie by the hair, brutally jerking her head back.
Please, don't hurt her...
Hurt this princess? (beat)
Would I do that? They cough out laughs. Gang Banger #1 looks into Rennie's eyes, his barrel still on her skin.

You look like a party girl, princess.  How'd you like to go on a date with me  and my friend? If you're free, that  is. More phlegm-filled laughs. He drags her away, Gang Banger #2 backing away with him with his gun still trained on  the others.
You follow and we'll blow her fuckin'  head off, comprende? The others watch helplessly as Rennie is abducted.
We can't let those gang-bangers get  away, man... Julius starts to move after them. McCulloch grabs him.
You heard him! We have to call the  police Julius jerks away from McCulloch's grasp. But he knows  McCulloch        is right.
Everyone split up -- we'll cover more  ground that way.
I don't think that's such a safe idea
My niece's life hangs in the balance  right now!! Every second counts. No more rebuttal. They hurry off.

It's a narrow passageway between warehouses...decrepit  brownstones with shattered chicken-wire windows, moss  growing on the bricks. The Gang Bangers appear with  Rennie, dragging her down some concrete steps.

Welcome to the casbah, princess. PAN AROUND with them as they walk through a thick blanket of STEAM which pours out of a factory vent. We MOVE  through the mist with them, revealing a tattered, rain- soaked couch and chair, upholstery shredded. A spool once used for telephone wire functions as their coffee table.  They splash through puddles, throwing her down on the  couch.
--looking back at the steam vent. JASON APPEARS IN THE  BILLOWING MIST.

as a yellowish liquid squirts out the dirty needle. WIDEN to find Gang Banger #2 holding it with transfixed eyes,  his compadre holding a squirming Rennie down on the  couch, tearing back her jacket to reveal a bare arm.
Please don't...
Loosen up, baby. It'll feel way better if you're stoned.
Amongst the slime and cigarette butts is a discarded  syringe. Jason picks it up.
just as Gang Banger #2 jabs Rennie with the needle.  Gang Banger #1 wrestles off his torn leather jacket,  pushing Rennie back on the exposed foam padding as his  friend watches excitedly.

Slang us some more 'caine, JoJo. We're  in for a long night. Gang Banger #2 runs out the back way. #1 tears open  Rennie's blouse, his filthy mouth moving to her neck.  Rennie spits in his face. He hesitates not in SLAPPING  HER HARD.
It's your parade, princess. Can be  smooth or can be rough. Your choice. She closes .her eyes, trying to blot out what's about to  happen.
I think I'm in love. PUSH IN on his face as his neck arches down, bringing his lips toward her chest. Just before contact he GRUNTS  THICKLY, HIS EYES BUGGING OUT.
Jason is standing right behind him, shoving something  into his back, out of frame. He thrusts it again,  bringing with it one more horrific grunt from the kid.  Jason goes for number three and:
Jason's syringe gets shoved completely through him, the  needle sticking out his front side.
opens her eyes, looking into the dead boy's face as  blood drips from his mouth. He collapses in front of  her, giving way to a view of JASON TOWERING OVER HER. At  the same time:
comes around the corner.
Forgot my money, holmes... Ha stops dead in his tracks at the sight of Jason.
Who the fuck are you? Jason paces toward him. The kid glances at his dead  friend arched over the couch, quickly whipping out his  .38.
You're dead, fuckhead.
...but Jason keeps on coming. Five shots later and  Jason's still standing, easily picking up the slime ball  and SHOVING HIM HEAD FIRST INTO THE MOSSY BRICK WALL. The kid falls in a bloody heap.
shoves Gang Banger #1 off of her as Jason returns his  attention to her. She grabs a loose brick and FLINGS IT  AT HIM, CRACKING HIS HOCKEY MASK, momentarily  disorienting him. Rennie sprints away.
as Julius runs into view, looking down a menacing alley,  spotting a phone booth. He hurries for it.
Like a cat watching a bird, we watch Julius head for the  booth.
slams open the booth door, grabbing the receiver,  punching the "operator" digit. SLOWLY PUSH IN on him as  he waits for an answer. Several more rings.
C'mon... Finally a click and muffled words from the operator.

Get me the police -- this is an  emergency... SMASH! as JASON'S FIST CRASHES THROUGH THE BOOTH WINDOW,  GRABBING JULIUS BY THE THROAT. Julius grips Jason's scaly arm with all his strength, staring at the cracked hockey  mask framed in the shattered window. Julius summons all  his strength, tearing free of Jason's grasp and running  out the door. The phone is left dangling.
with no apparent direction. Literally running for his  life.
He's just as quick, but smoother and more methodical.
heading up the alley, spotting a fire escape, diverting  his course straight for it.
as Julius LEAPS ONTO IT, dragging himself up, climbing as fast as is humanly possible.
...but Jason is-far from human, easily negotiating the  wrought-iron stairs and rapidly catching up.
as Julius' head appears, clawing his way onto the tar- papered surface, running to the opposite side. A second  later, JASON HOPS UP RIGHT BEHIND HIM.

as Julius soon learns the awful truth that the only way  up is the only way down...with the exception of a head- splitting freefall. No way is he gonna jump. Julius turns back to Jason, raising his fists, psyching himself up for the fight of his life. He whispers to himself:

Use the combos and keep the feet  light... THE FIGHT BEGINS, man against monster, each sizing the  other up.  Jason takes the first swing, Julius deftly dodging him  and countering with left-right-left combination. They  have absolutely no effect. Julius follows up with a round of kidney punches. Again, nothing. Julius finds himself  being forced back against the rings, which in this case  is the edge of the roof. He risks a glance backwards and  sees:
It's a long, rough way down. It's do or die time.

as Julius SLAMS PUNCH AFTER PUNCH INTO JASON, forcing him back to the center of the rooftop, spending every last  ounce of his energy in doing so. He throws one more  feeble punch, knowing it's his last.
Take your best shot, motherfucker... Jason gladly obliges, winding up and recoiling with a  punch none of us expected...
gets literally knocked off his shoulders, cascading off  the edge of the rooftop, and:
--the decapitated head lands on a sloped roof below,  rolling down towards street level and falling into a  garbage-filled dumpster.
as Rennie dizzily runs down the alley, the effects of the drugs kicking in.
Blurry, disoriented, erratic. Suddenly A FIGURE JUMPS OUT FROM A CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF HER.
It's SEAN. He rushes to her, sensing her disorientation.
Rennie...what'd they do to you??
Drugs... (serious pause)
Then Jason came. He's here, Sean. Oh Jesus. He never expected this.
We have to find the others. Together they run off.
as Miss Van Deusen briskly walks below us, far from  relaxed in this threatening environment.
She moves forward, the only sound being her shoes against wet asphalt. Four more steps, then a DARK, OUT OF FOCUS  FIGURE STEPS OUT BEHIND HER WITH A GUN.
Freeze. RACK FOCUS to find a uniformed IRISH COP standing there,  service revolver raised. McCulloch steps out from the  alcove as well, recognizing Miss Van Deusen.
It's okay -- she's with me. She turns around, lowering her hands, utterly relieved.

My apologies, Miss. My unit's right  over here. They head through an ABANDONED PARKING LOT towards a  concrete wall with stairs; about six feet above the wall  is an upper street, where his patrol car is parked. They  get halfway through the lot when they hear:
Hey!
as Sean and Rennie run to join them from the alley.  McCulloch rushes to his niece.
Rennie, thank God... But Rennie goes to Miss Van Deusen instead. It's a bitter pill for McCulloch.
Jason's here in New York.
Don't be ridiculous!
Is it true, Rennie?? She nods, unable to repress her fear.
Is this the lass in question?
(stewing)
Yes.
Who is...Jason?
He's a walking corpse, a phantasm from  hell. The others stare at McCulloch angrily. Miss Van Deusen  turns to the confused policeman.
I'm afraid you'll have some trouble  believing us.
So try me.
parked above the abandoned garage, the interior dark. The Cop and our heroes appear in the background, coming  towards it.
You're right -- I find it a tall tale  indeed.  But you seem like honest folks so I'm  inclined to believe at least some of  it.
(relieved)
Thank you. The first thing we' have to  do is find Julius.
I'm sure he'll pop up soon enough. Why  don't you climb in the back while I  radio for backup.

head_text.subj: THE BACK DOOR AS HE SWINGS IT

text: OPEN...but even in this darkness, we see that it's  empty. They climb in. The Cop opens his drivers door,  and...
The car dome light blinks on, and...
Our four survivors' faces are brightly illuminated,  INSTANTLY CHANGING TO GASPS AND SCREAMS because:
Julius' severed head is resting on the dash board,  staring back at them!!!

reacting to their terror, seeing Julius' head, quickly  grabbing the radio mike. But he has no time for a message because JASON REACHES UP FROM THE PARKING LOT PIT BELOW,  GRABBING THE COP'S ANKLE, DRAGGING HIM DOWN. The radio is still in his grasp.
as the radio cord grows taut, finally snapping. The  Irish cop's awful yell echoes over it, silencing after a  sick THUD.
The foursome instantly try to flee the car, but police  cars have no door handles in the back.
There aren't any handles!! Cocaine flowing through her veins, Rennie acts  hyperkinetically, scratching her way over the seats just  as:
appears at the parking lot stairs, STALKING STRAIGHT  TOWARDS THE CAR.
There is no time for escape. Rennie finds the ignition  and fires it up, jamming it into drive and STOMPING ON  THE ACCELERATOR. Julius' head rolls off the dash, onto  the floorboards.
Her vision is still a stoned one but clear enough to set  her target. We come straight at the abominable creature  and:
Jason is mowed down.
slams on the brakes, jerks it into reverse and FLOORS IT  AGAIN.
as the automobile grinds back over him a second time.
stomps on the brake pedal and the tires SCREECH TO A  HALT. They all take a moment to catch their breath,  looking out the front window...
Jason lies dead on the asphalt. For about two seconds. He SLOWLY STANDS.
desperately throws it into forward again, gripping the  wheel and RACING FORWARD.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)

text: Jason's standing there for one second, but the next  moment he is LEAPING OUT OF THE WAY...
...and the squad car SMASHES THROUGH A CHAIN LINK FENCE,  FREEFALLING TO THE ABANDONED PARKING LOT BELOW.
as the car bottoms out, then swerves into a sharp right  turn, racing down the alley.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)

text: as Jason appears at the end of the alley, blocking their  retreat.
as Rennie stomps the brake pedal, jerking it into  reverse...
as she backs up, changes gears and races down an  intersecting alley.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)

text: speeding towards an escape when JASON POPS OUT AGAIN!  He's everywhere all at once...
slamming on the discs one more time, flooring it into  reverse.
as the squad car's rear tires smoke and spin, finally  gripping pavement.

head_text.subj: POINT OF VIEW OUT REAR WINDOW, (STUNT DRIVE)

text: as we fly backwards...and JASON APPEARS BEHIND THEM!!
--Rennie's terrified face filling it, seeing that Jason  is in back of them.
as they screech to a halt one final time, rapidly  rotating in the opposite direction and speeding out of  frame.
Rennie is almost maniacal now, her knuckles white around  the vinyl wheel, her foot practically mashed through the  floorboard.
Rennie, for God's sake slow down!! She doesn't hear him, or anything for that matter. Her  eyes remain straight ahead, never blinking.

There's a FIGURE standing in the distance. But it looks  too small to be Jason. We RUSH TOWARDS IT, CHANGING INTO  SLOW MOTION JUST BEFORE IMPACT. The figure is a dripping  wet boy with a sinister smile. YOUNG JASON.
as the front of the squad car RAMS THE BRICK WALL HEAD- ON, THE HOOD BURSTING INTO FLAMES.

as the front passenger door is shoved open by Sean, who  drags out Rennie. McCulloch follows close behind, helping Sean carry her away from the wreckage, over by a row of  old oil drums filled with slime and rainwater. Then it  suddenly hits Sean...
Miss Van Deusen... He takes two steps back to the car when:
The squad car interior is ENGULFED IN A BALL OF FLAMES.

opens her dazed eyes, seeing Miss Van Deusen's body  charring inside the wreckage. It's incomprehensible. She  numbly gets to her feet, stepping towards it. Something  makes her hesitate: she peers down at the asphalt...

A pool of gasoline has collected, flames dancing across  its glassy surface. Suddenly a TINY ROWBOAT DISSOLVES IN, not unlike the lifeboat she was so afraid of. The  rowboat glides across the surface of the burning  gasoline, TWO PEOPLE RIDING IN IT. The flames and asphalt SLOWLY FADE OUT AND GIVE WAY TO A SERENE LAKE.

Shimmering water, clouds and pine trees reflected in it.  The rowboat floats into view. The two occupants are YOUNG RENNIE and MCCULLOCH. She's wearing a bathing suit and an innocent smile. And not an inkling of fear about the  water. She stands, letting the sun soak into her.
What a beautiful day.
Perfect for a swim, isn't it? She frowns at him, looking away.
You've been coming out here every  summer for the last three years, young  lady, and you still haven't learned  how.
I'll take some lessons this time. I  promise. She bends over, splashing the water.
That's what you said last year. I  think the time for your first swimming  lesson has just come. The splashing stops.
You don't want to end up drowning like  that Voorhees boy, do you? She's instantly tense.
He never learned how either and he's  still at the bottom of this lake.
He is not.
Oh, he is indeed. And ready to pull  down anybody who falls in and can't  swim.
You're telling a lie.
Am I? Let's find out. ...And quicker than she's able to react to it, MCCULLOCH  PUSHES HER OVERBOARD.
as Rennie's body violently disrupts the calm surface.  She immediately begins to flounder. McCulloch calmly  leans over the edge.
Better swim before Jason drags you  down, Rennie. Come on, you can do  it... ...but Rennie thrashes in the water, struggling to keep  from sinking under the surface.
Her uncle's face blurs and clears as water splashes her  eyes.
I...I can't...
You can and you will! Swim, Rennie!
is too panicked to obey.
Hhhhelp...me.... She coughs on some water then disappears...
The world above her ceases to exist, murky lake water  taking over. Rennie looks-down, and to her horror...
Young Jason is grabbing her ankle and dragging her  down. The whole image BURSTS INTO FLAMES and we:

as the gasoline continues to burn, the rowboat gone.  ADJUST to find RENNIE'S FACE, the flames of the car  wreckage flickering over her glassy eyes. She looks up at Miss Van Deusen's body one last time before:
The auto's fuel tank EXPLODES, SHRAPNEL FLYING  EVERYWHERE.
She looks up at her uncle with knowing eyes. Eyes that  tell him she's remembered everything.
You pushed me...
(defensively)
I was only trying to teach you. But I  pulled you out, Rennie. I saved your  life. Rennie just stares, incredulous.
You son of a bitch... She lets it build until she's ready to explode...then:
He was down there!!! And Rennie runs off. McCulloch starts to follow but Sean  grabs him, shoving him down.

You keep away from her! Sean chases after Rennie. Camera methodically PANS BACK  TO MCCULLOCH, crumpled on the ground. A very bitter man.  He wipes his hands, getting ready to stand when THE  SHADOW FALLS OVER HIM. His skin fades to porcelain white.
You...are...NOT POSSIBLE. But possible, and actual, he is. A PAIR OF ROTTED ARMS  EXTEND DOWN, RIPPING HIM OUT OF FRAME.

as the walking corpse lifts a screaming McCulloch over  his head, carrying him over to one of the scum-filled OIL DRUMS, SHOVING HIM HEAD-FIRST INTO IT. Jason grips  McCulloch's thrashing legs as bubbles rise to the surface of the slime, a pathetic gurgling reverberating out the  drum. At last McCulloch's appendages go limp. Jason  releases him, moving on.
as Sean runs into view, glancing around, spotting Rennie, crouched against a crumbled brick wall. No tears...only  hate. Sean sits down next to her. After several  moments...
I was at school when they told me.  'Rennie, we have some very bad news...  your parents have been killed in an  auto accident.' Sean gently takes her hand, sharing her internal agony.
It seems like everybody I care about  ends up... She can't finish. PUSH IN as Sean kisses her on the  forehead, then makes her look into his eyes.
Not this time. He caresses her face; it develops into a tender kiss.  Finally she holds him back, letting it out. At the same  time:
Somebody is creeping at a low angle towards them.
are lost in their shared quiet moment...until the  GROWLING SOUND becomes audible. They look up, seeing:
cautiously approaching them. Rennie stands, absolutely  relieved.
Toby... She starts to move towards him and her dog SNARLS  VICIOUSLY, CROUCHING BACK IN FEAR.
What's wrong, boy? Another protective growl, then:
as Jason stampedes through a stack of crates and garbage  cans behind them.
abruptly flee down the alley, Jason in mad pursuit.
as Rennie, Sean and the dog run straight towards us,  Jason swiftly catching up. FAST TRACK WITH THEM over to a deserted, rain-slicked SUBWAY ENTRANCE.
as they bang through the glass doors, sailing past us.  Three beats later, JASON APPEARS, not bothering to open  the door, STAMPEDING RIGHT THROUGH THE GLASS.
Sean, Rennie and Toby sail down the escalators past a few scattered COMMUTERS. Again, Jason appears, looming tall  at the top. He starts down the "up" escalator.
as an ELDERLY COUPLE rises toward us. Their reactions  grow more bleak the closer we get, finally registering  terror as we plow right through them.
Sean and Rennie hop over a metal turnstile, Toby crawling under it. A TICKET TAKER leans out his window, shouting  at them.
Hey! The teenagers are soon forgotten as JASON SMASHES THROUGH

head_text.subj: THE TURNSTILE LIKE THE TERMINATOR, TEARING THE ALUMINUM

text: WHEEL RIGHT OFF ITS BASE. The Ticket Taker reacts  speechlessly, deciding not to press his luck.
as Sean and Rennie slide up to the edge of the track pit, SEEING THE LIGHTS OF AN APPROACHING TRAIN which is taking too long to get there.
Come on... ...but Jason arrives before the train. Toby barks and  snarls, trying to protect them. Jason is unfazed. He  treads toward them and:
leaps onto Jason, sinking his teeth into the monster's  throat. Jason wrestles the animal into submission just  as:
streaks into the station. A fraction of time later:
heaves the dog in front of the train.
shrieks in horror as Toby disappears inside the pit just  as the train roars by.

They're New Yorkers, but not callous enough to stomach  this, quickly scattering. Even a group of severe  SKINHEADS decide they can wait for the next train,  quickly heading up the escalators after seeing Jason in  action.

makes Rennie look away, dragging her with him along the  platform edge in retreat as Jason returns his attention  to them. They reach the end of the platform, having no  choice but to board the front car.
as the doors whoosh shut...but Jason PRIES THEM OPEN. The TRAIN ENGINEER glances back from his booth, seeing Jason  making the improper entry.
Hey pal, you can't do that... A second later he's gotten a good look at Jason. It's too late for a retraction as JASON SAVAGELY JAMS HIS HEAD  INTO THE TRAIN CONSOLE.
as the Engineer's arm KNOCKS THE THROTTLE FORWARD...
...and the train begins to move, racing into the black  tunnel.
as Rennie and Sean run for their lives, arriving at the  end of a car, jamming the separating doors open and  entering the next car. Jason follows right behind.
as the train thunders through the station without  stopping, baffling several waiting COMMUTERS.
--seeing Sean and Rennie disappear through another  connecting door. We storm our way through it into the  next car right after them. A handful of TRAVELERS cower  away from us.
as the train rapidly speeds past us, showing no signs of  slowing down.

as Sean and Rennie come through another set of separating doors, rushing through... finding they're in the last  car. They look back, seeing Jason enter at the opposite  end. The monster stalks forward. Sean's eyes dart  around. He spots the EMERGENCY STOP CORD. HE LEAPS FOR  IT.
...and the train SCREECHES TO A HALT.
The sudden stop throws Jason on his back. Sean throws the rear door open, jumping out with Rennie.
as Sean and Rennie sprint down the center of the tracks  toward the light of the next station, running out of  strength.
as they emerge from the darkness, up to the edge of the  pit. Sean boosts Rennie up, starting to climb up himself  when:

fires out from the tunnel, grabbing onto Sean's ankle.  Rennie screams as Sean is dragged down...but he manages  to latch onto a chain securing a garbage receptacle.  Jason pulls harder, stretching Sean to his limit as  Rennie watches helplessly.
runs straight towards the track pit like a football  punter, RECOILING WITH HER RIGHT LEG, KICKING JASON  SQUARELY IN THE FACE.
trips backwards and LANDS ON THE THIRD, ELECTRIFIED RAIL, RECEIVING TEN THOUSAND VOLTS. His body smokes and  convulses, finally sizzling out. He appears to be  terminated!!!
as they get to their feet, holding each other tight,  looking down on the now-dead undead creature.

as our heroes arise into the neon-filled big city  wonderland, relieved to be alive, gazing around at the  awesome spectacle known as Times Square. A huge DIGITAL  CLOCK tells us it's a quarter to midnight. Sean wraps his arm around her.
It's over, Rennie. It's finally over. Camera RISES ABOVE THEM, RACKING BACK TO THE SUBWAY EXIT. Guess who has just made an encore...with more energy  than ever!!!
look all around them, having never been to a city as big  as this. They finally turn far enough around to spot  JASON in a series of three quick cuts, each one closer  than the last.
God...please no... But Jason keeps on coming.
Somebody help us!! He's going to kill  us!!! But the heavy Times Square foot traffic ignores her,  bustling onward. Rennie and Sean have no choice but to  flee again.

shoves his way through the preoccupied pedestrians;  they've certainly seen weirder characters than him here.  He moves past a group of STREET URCHINS listening to some rap from their ghetto blaster. His foot obliterates  their stereo system with one stride. They instantly pull  out switchblades and chains.

You're dead meat, slime bag. Jason stops, turning around, towering over the kids. He  has blood and gore caked everywhere, his skin charred  from the electrocution. Jason starts to remove his mask,  facing them squarely.
as Jason's mask comes off out-of-frame. Their tough faces turn to putty, scared completely shitless.

Hey man, it's cool, it's cool... They turn tail and race like the wind. Jason steps  forward so that we're looking at the back of his head,  never seeing his naked face. He slips his hockey mask on  again, turns into a CLOSE UP, then exits.

filled with noise, smoke and derelicts. A tough,  redheaded WAITRESS with a thick Brooklyn accent stands  behind the countertop, a wall of mirrors behind her. The  front door bangs open with the entrance of Sean and  Rennie, rushing up to the waitress.
(out of breath)
You have to call the police...
Please, hurry... A telephone sits right next to her, but this is New York.
There's a pay phone in back. They start to run.
...but it's broken.
You don't understand -- there's a  maniac trying to kill us!!!
(blase)
Welcome to New York. There's no time for further response as JASON CRASHES

head_text.subj: THROUGH THE DINER DOOR, MOWING A PATH STRAIGHT TOWARDS

text: THEM. Sean and Rennie run out the back as the Waitress  eyes Jason with complete disbelief.
as the BURLY CHEF comes out to confront him. Jason FLINGS HIM HEAD FIRST INTO THE JUKEBOX.
picks up the telephone, really pissed off.

climbs off his counter stool, revealing a HUGE BOWIE  KNIFE. Jason plows straight for him and the Biker STABS  JASON IN THE HEART. Jason has little reaction, pulling it out, tossing it aside. The Biker's face goes wan, backing away.
stops in mid-dial. Fear is starting to register now.
lifts the very large man and EFFORTLESSLY HEAVES HIM INTO THE MIRROR OVER THE COUNTER.

feels the phone receiver slipping from her grasp, her  mouth trembling. She backs away from the beast as far as  she can. Jason has no time to waste on her, trampling out the back after Rennie and Sean as the other patrons  shrink from him.
as Sean fumbles to unlock three deadbolts and two chains, finally getting the back door open and springing into:

They run about ten yards before realizing the alley is a  dead end. Sean and Rennie start to head back the other  way when JASON MOWS OUT FROM THE DINER DOOR. Their vision scatters everywhere in search of a retreat...
Look! She's spotted a MANHOLE COVER, slightly ajar. They  haven't the luxury of thinking about it, Sean sliding the cover back as Jason comes forth.

as they descend into hell...a massive chamber consisting  of tall columns, slimy catacombs and three feet of  stagnant water. Their alternatives are nil; Sean and  Rennie join hands, wading through the swill, splashing  deeper into the labyrinth.
as the dim streetlight glowing in the above world is  eclipsed by JASON, making his way down after them.

An oval tunnel slanted downward into pitch blackness.  Dim overhead lights illuminate salt deposits and eery  rust formations. Rennie and Sean appear at the far end,  wading from the sewage as the tunnel rises toward us.
as they come forward at a brisk but cautious pace,  strangers in a very strange land.

sloshing through the slime. All is silent until Sean's  foot TRIPS OVER A BARREL labeled HUGHES CHEMICAL PLANT.  A vaporous green substance oozes out the rusty end of  the container, sizzling on the around.
carefully sidestep it, continuing on. They make it  another ten yards when A FIGURE LEAPS OUT FROM AN ALCOVE, GRIPPING A HUGE WRENCH. Rennie's scream echoes through  the tunnel.
...but it's a middle-aged SANITATION ENGINEER who lowers  the wrench, as frightened as they are.
What the hell are you kids doing down  here?
Can you help us get out??
I sure can and we don't have a minute  to waste. He begins quickly packing up his tools.
What do you mean?
Toxic waste, son. This sewer floods  out with the stuff on the 13th of  every month, right at midnight. (checks watch)
And that's less than ten minutes from  now. Rennie looks down the dark tunnels in all directions,  swallowing hard.
Follow me. He clicks on his high powered flashlight and quickly  leads them down:
...no less threatening than the one they just left. When  they pass a lightless intersecting corridor, JASON EJECTS

head_text.subj: HIMSELF FROM IT, TACKLING THE SANITATION ENGINEER AND

text: rolls through the muck, its beam splashing erratically  across the polluted walls.
begins BASHING JASON'S HEAD IN WITH HIS WRENCH but the  monster drags the kicking and screaming man into TUNNEL  #3.
tries to help up Sean but he's been knocked into the  opposite wall, barely conscious.
Run, Rennie... She's struck with indecisive shock, looking into Tunnel  #3, seeing:

head_text.subj: A GRUESOME SHADOW ON THE WALL

text: Jason arches his back with wrench in hand, hammering it  over and over into the Sanitation Engineer's skull.
backs away but does not run. The time has come to face  her fears.

as Jason takes one more vengeful stroke, finishing him  off. He steps from Tunnel #3 with the scarlet-coated  tool, his shadow becoming flesh. He moves straight for  Sean, who has no hope for escape. Jason cocks the wrench  over Sean's skull...and suddenly his hockey mask is  SPLASHED WITH A BRIGHT LIGHT. Jason stops, turning  directly into it.
Rennie is blinding us with the sanitation Engineer's  flashlight, giving us only brief glimpses of herself in  the reflective wet surroundings.
You never got me in the lake, Jason.  And you're not going to get me now  either. Her voice is defiant. She carefully backstops, the  irritating light never leaving us.
has been sufficiently taunted. He moves after her.
as the bright beam leaves our eyes, Rennie dashing down  the intersecting tunnel (#1).
stomping through the sludge, picking up speed. He's  wanted to kill Rennie most of all.

as Rennie dashes up to the HUGHES CHEMICAL DRUM Sean  tripped over, using the back end of the flashlight to  crush in the can's rusted lid. The metal is flimsy but  still resists her blows. She frantically hammers harder.
He's moving like a freight train now, an addict rolling  after his fix.
as the butt of the flashlight dents the metal, ultimately causing it to cave in.

--Looking through his unblinking eyes, whipping into  Tunnel #1...where we catch a fleeting glimpse of Rennie  flinging the contents of the oil drum. A half second  later a WAVE OF GRAY/GREEN LIQUID FLIES AT US...
and his hockey mask is SPLASHED WITH TOXIC WASTE,  SEEPING INTO HIS MASK'S EYE SLITS. He careens back as if  her were a rabid dog receiving a load of point-blank  buckshot.
drops the can, fumbling for the flashlight again.
as the radiant flashlight beam finds his mask, the  plastic beginning to bubble and melt. RUSH INTO A TIGHT

HIDEOUS FACE: rotted flesh, some of it sizzling from the  chemical. Worms slithering out his nostrils. And his  eyes...or lack thereof. They're like two raw quail eggs  frying in liquid green pollutant...and the yolks just  broke, running down his face.
as the beam begins to waver in her quivering grasp. RISE  TO FIND RENNIE'S FACE, reacting to the stomach-turning  sight of Jason's visage. She grabs hold of her senses and RUNS.

as Rennie skirts past the blinded creature: WHIP PAN WITH HER as she turns down Tunnel #2, heading back toward  Sean. CONTINUE TO QUICKLY PAN AROUND until we've come  around 360 degrees and are back on JASON, in no way  ready to give up. He staggers after Rennie.
as Rennie skids up to Sean, still dazed. She grabs him,  shaking hard.

Get up, Sean!!! His eyes blink, only half coherent. Then an inconceivable terror registers in her ears...A LOW, DEEP RUMBLING  SOUND, COMING FROM UP AHEAD. Her head jerks in the  direction of her planned retreat:
An ominously empty tunnel, soon to be filled with the  unthinkable. The sound of RUSHING LIQUID is growing at  leaps and bounds.
as her trembling chin rises, looking at:
The dim overhead lights are beginning to vibrate from  the approaching flood.
rotates her head and sees:
vision or no vision, he is lurching towards her  relentlessly. She is literally sandwiched between hell  and high water.
drags Sean to his feet with the strength of a possessed  woman, pulling him over to a SERVICE LADDER attached to  the intersecting alcove wall.
(screaming)
Climb!!! She shoves him up it from below, Sean summoning  everything he's got to obey her. Rennie shoots a stare  back down the tunnel...

The overhead lights are banging around like an earthquake has just hit; the liquid will be arriving any second. Her vision WHIP PANS 180 DEGREES TO FIND JASON APPROACHING  FROM THE OPPOSITE END, groping around with his scaly arms like the claws of a roto-tiller.
as Rennie starts up after Sean, looking down and seeing:
within ten feet of them, shifting directly for the ladder like he's working on some kind of radar.
slips on the rusty ladder, regaining her footing. and  rushing higher. She takes her final glance into the  tunnel, the ultimate horror registering in her corneas as she sees:
A million gallons of green-brown toxic waste splash into  the far intersection, FILLING THE TUNNEL, FLOODING  STRAIGHT FOR CAMERA.
has just started to climb the ladder when the wind and  smell of the rushing toxic waste bombards him. His  decomposed head swivels to face:
Tons of lethal sewage, stopping for no one. Arriving in  seconds.
He doesn't need vision to confirm what his other senses  already know. Jason's mouth begins to quaver...AND THE

head_text.subj: FIRST WORDS HE HAS EVER SPOKEN COME OUT, IN THE VOICE OF

text: Mmmmmmmmmommy...DON'T LET ME DROWN,  MOMMY... Camera speeds toward his gaping mouth and DOWN HIS THROAT as lightning arcs off his mucous covered insides. We  sink deeper into his guts, fire and smoke flaring into  our eves, eventually coming to a WELL IN THE PIT OF HIS  STOMACH, FILLED WITH BLOOD...and EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON IS  DROWNING IN IT.
Hhhhelp me.... A split second later:
The wall of deadly toxic liquid ENGULFS JASON.

The powerful flood thrashes the ladder about two inches  below Rennie's feet, the force of it fiercely shaking  their rusty support. They are clinging to the ladder with their eyes squeezed shut. Praying for survival.
We are drowning in a chunky cloud of sewage, rushing over and under us.
The digital clock we saw earlier abruptly CHIMES

head_text.subj: MIDNIGHT, HUGE BOLTS OF LIGHTNING CRACKING OVER

text: as the sewage level begins to drop. Rennie opens her  eyes, glancing straight down and seeing.

The ladder beneath them reappears...which gives way to a  PAIR OF HANDS GRIPPING THE BOTTOM RUNG. The liquid drops  further, unshrouding the now-dead corpse of EIGHT YEAR  OLD JASON. He's a relatively normal looking boy,  probably the way he looked back in 1957...right when he  drowned in Crystal Lake. Jason Voorhees has finally been put to rest.
Rennie and Sean stagger out from a side street, holding  each other up...relief etched in their matured faces.
I hear there's a statue here that's 22  stories tall. Rennie would smile if she could. She kisses his cheek.  They amble on.
...coming out from another alley, creeping up behind them through a crowd of pedestrians. About the height of a  small child.
walk arm in arm, exhausted and oblivious to their  pursuer. But something, some innate perception causes  Rennie to slow...and stop. Her eyes register a horrid  fear and she WHIPS AROUND TO FACE...
Limping on all fours, filthy with grease-matted fur. The  whimpering dog crawls up to her, Rennie bending down,  hugging her animal like she'll never let go.
Oh Toby...
as Sean bends down too, ruffling the dog's fur, standing  again with Rennie. The three survivors enter the collage  of pedestrians, bright lights and skyscrapers.  It is finally over.
